programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores different habitats across the nation, from the heather moorlands of the Peak District to the north Norfolk shingle shoreline, uncovering vital links between the plant, animal and insect worlds. Ray begins in the Forest of Dean in Gloucestershire - one of the few remaining ancient forests in England - where he encounters a family of wild boar and a rare goshawk.(n)

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the coastal landscape of north Norfolk, visiting shallow pools that are home to rare natterjack toads and a shingle spit that attracts hundreds of grey and common seals. He also finds out why the area has been dubbed Britain's bird-watching capital.(n)

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits the Breckland in East Anglia, which is home to an abundance of wildlife, including brown hares, stone-curlews and pool frogs, despite having the hottest summers and coldest winters in England. Ray also ventures below ground to explore an ancient flint mine known as Grimes Graves, where he uncovers the antler of a red deer that has been there since the Stone Age.(n)

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the Peak District, one of the most popular places in the British countryside, where he spots short-eared owls hunting for voles and catches a glimpse of some of the red grouse and mountain hares that live among the heather of the Dark Peak. He also heads to the limestone uplands of the White Peak, whose rivers and streams are home to rare great-crested newts and caddis flies.(n)

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores Somerset's low-lying wetlands, one of the largest feeding grounds in Europe, where he spots little egret herons hunting for food and gathers reedmace pollen to make a pancake. He also catches a glimpse of an emperor dragonfly, and watches an otter gliding through water at dusk.(n)

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits a selection of Britain's hay meadows, uncovering vital links between them and some of the nation's most spectacular wildlife, including bees and butterflies that live among the diverse and colourful wild flowers, as well as green woodpeckers and barn owls. He also explains why more than 90 per cent of meadows have disappeared from the landscape since the end of the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: An insight into the lives of some of the world's cutest animals.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: An exploration of Australia's underwater ecosystem, one of the natural wonders of the world and the largest living structure on the planet. In the first of three programmes, marine biologist Monty Halls examines the complex form of the coral reef itself and the wildlife that lives on it, from deadly fish-hunting snails and sharks that can walk on land to fighting corals and parrotfish, which cocoon themselves every night.(n)

programme.title: Life on Earth: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: The natural history series' focuses on another fossil found in China, this time allowing researchers to trace the evolution of mammals back another 35 million years.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall encounters an unusual fish in the waters of British Columbia, meets a giant Pacific octopus, and gets a surprise while kayaking among killer whales.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the wildlife of British Columbia, Canada. A search for a particularly large sea lion results in an unexpected encounter with a killer whale, and the naturalist tries his hand at becoming a raccoon in Vancouver.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining animals on the hunt in deserts and grasslands, where prey has nowhere to hide - but neither do predators, making the element of surprise difficult to come by. Cheetahs use their unmatched speed to solve this problem, while lions have learned to use desert storms to conceal their approach and caracals are able to blend into the tall dry grass. The programme also features footage of bald eagles stalking snow geese, hot rod ants who rely on the sun to kill their food, and headlight beetles that lure termites to their death with an eerie glow.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: An exploration of Australia's underwater ecosystem, one of the natural wonders of the world and the largest living structure on the planet. In the first of three programmes, marine biologist Monty Halls examines the complex form of the coral reef itself and the wildlife that lives on it, from deadly fish-hunting snails and sharks that can walk on land to fighting corals and parrotfish, which cocoon themselves every night.(n)

programme.title: Shark
programme.desc: Wildlife documentary venturing below the waves to examine the ocean predators' behaviour. The first film reveals their many different hunting methods, from blacktip sharks gathering in huge packs and herding fish into baitballs, to tasselled wobbegongs, which ambush their prey. Other highlights include Greenland sharks, which live under the arctic ice, whitetip reef sharks - arguably the masters of night-time hunting - and the great white, shown stalking fur seals off the coast of South Africa.(n)

programme.title: Tornado Alley
programme.sub-title: Big City Twister: Mayhem in Miami.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring what would happen if a tornado touched down in Miami Beach, Florida.(n)

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: Spike Jonze's Oscar-nominated, BAFTA-winning film is based on a simple premise. On the 71/2th floor of an office block, John Cusack discovers a door that's a portal into John Malkovich's head for 15 minutes (before you're spat out on the New Jersey Turnpike). He and fellow worker Catherine Keener start selling tickets, much to the bemusement of Malkovich, who finds himself regularly invaded. Matters become complicated when Cusack's wife (Cameron Diaz) gets involved and what was a partnership becomes a ménage-a-trois (or quatre, including Malkovich). Totally unique, totally bizarre, totally wonderful(n)

programme.title: Diamonds Are Forever
programme.desc: A diamond smuggling investigation leads James Bond to Las Vegas, where he uncovers an extortion plot headed by his nemesis, Ernst Stavro Blofeld(n)

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: George C Scott, Karl Malden, Stephen Young, Michael Strong, Frank Latimore, James Edwards. Monumental biopic of the great but controversial US military general, George S Patton. The film follows his World War II career from his triumphs over Rommel in North Africa, through his demotion for mistreating a soldier under his command and up to the Battle of the Bulge. George C Scott's towering performance earned him an Oscar, which he refused to accept(n)

programme.title: The 5th Wave
programme.desc: Based on the acclaimed 2013 young-adult sci-fi novel by Rick Yancey, The 5th Wave follows a 16-year-old survivor of a catastrophic alien invasion. Cassie (Chloë Grace Moretz) is a high-school student leading a normal life, including a crush on a football star (Nick Robinson), when extraterrestrials invade Earth and kill millions of humans. Now, she must rescue her kidnapped brother (Zackary Arthur) while figuring out whom she can trust. Ron Livingston and Maggie Siff co-star as Cassie's parents. Directed by J Blakeson(n)

programme.title: The Undefeated
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a Union colonel leading a herd of 3,000 horses into Mexico with his adopted Indian son runs into an exodus of Confederates heading the same way. But conflict between the rival factions is averted when they find a common enemy - the Mexican bandits intent on stealing the horses and killing all the Americans they can find - and reunite in a weary trek towards an uncertain future(n)

programme.title: Moonraker
programme.desc: Secret agent James Bond finds himself battling yet another megalomaniacal villain in this entry in the long-running series of adventure films. This time Bond's opponent is Sir Hugo Drax, whose plans to destroy the earth with an atomic-powered rocket force Bond to add space travel to his resume(n)

programme.title: Flyboys
programme.desc: As World War I rages in Europe and Allied forces in France, Italy, and England find their resolve quickly diminishing due to the overwhelming force of the German juggernaut, a handful of brave American soldiers volunteer to join their French counterparts in learning to fly and fighting for freedom from above as the true story of the legendary Lafayette Escadrille comes to the screen in a breathtaking war adventure from Academy Award-winning director Tony Bill and famed producer Dean Devlin. They have come from all over the United States, ready and willing to put their lives on the line despite their country's initial pledge to not get involved with the all-consuming war that rages throughout Europe. Few could have foreseen the challenges faced by the world's first fighter pilots, however, and upon arriving at their aerodrome in France, the aspiring aviators are assigned to a new squadron under the command of war-ravaged Captain Thenault (Jean Reno) and battle-weary American pilot Reed Cassidy -- the sole survivor of his devastated former air brigade. With little encouragement from their fellow aviators and nothing to drive but their unifying goal of taking to the skies and offering up their lives in the name of freedom, the determined airmen of the Lafayette Escadrille set out to make history by embarking on the adventure of a lifetime. James Franco, Martin Henderson, and David Ellison star in a script penned by Phil Sears, Blake T. Evans, and David S. Ward(n)

programme.title: The 5th Wave
programme.desc: Based on the acclaimed 2013 young-adult sci-fi novel by Rick Yancey, The 5th Wave follows a 16-year-old survivor of a catastrophic alien invasion. programme.title: Eddie Murphy: Raw
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy returns to his stand-up roots in New York's Felt Forum with his very up-front set including a wicked parody of Bill Cosby moralising about Murphy's searing humour, the sexual revenge women can take anytime, the difference between a Big Mac and a Homeburger and Eddie's very own fantasy marriages. Proof that Murphy isn't just a big name movie star(n)

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: In Patriot Games, Harrison Ford plays former CIA agent Jack Ryan, taking over from Alec Baldwin, who had played author Tom Clancy's brainy protagonist in Hunt for Red October. This time around, Ryan foils an attempted assassination, thereby incurring the wrath of a maniacal Irish radical (Sean Bean). After seemingly neutralizing the villains, and deciding to celebrate the occasion with his wife (Anne Archer) and daughter (Thora Birch), everything appears to be back to normal; then all hell breaks loose. Author Tom Clancy himself bemoaned the liberties taken with his novel in the final sequences; the picture scored with audiences, however, and soon inspired a followup, A Clear and Present Danger (1994), also starring Ford(n)

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn(n)

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: Nothing can snap a cynical philosophy professor out of a mental funk, except for a young student whose presence offers a breath of fresh air in his otherwise unfulfilling existence(n)

programme.title: Eddie Murphy: Raw
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy returns to his stand-up roots in New York's Felt Forum with his very up-front set including a wicked parody of Bill Cosby moralising about Murphy's searing humour, the sexual revenge women can take anytime, the difference between a Big Mac and a Homeburger and Eddie's very own fantasy marriages. Proof that Murphy isn't just a big name movie star(n)

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a man who, after ten years of platonic friendship with a woman, realises he is in love with her - only to discover she is getting married before he is able to confess his true feelings. To win her over, he agrees to be her 'maid' of honour at the wedding he now wants to sabotage(n)

programme.title: Catch .44
programme.desc: Three friends take on a simple enough job: intercept a rival drug shipment for their crime boss at an isolated diner. But everyone soon realizes no one is who they seem to be and the job may be something else entirely. What started out as a simple task with clear instructions turns out to be a deadly game with big guns pointed at everyone(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: An ageing rocker returns home to her estranged family after years on the road following her dreams, and must face the music as she tries to make things right with her loved ones(n)

programme.title: Thunderball
programme.desc: In his fourth outing as James Bond, Sean Connery comes up against the evil Emilio Largo, who is holding the world to ransom with a nuclear bomb stolen from NATO. Agent 007 promptly packs his bags and heads for the Bahamas to save the world, armed with a devastating array of gadgetry(n)

programme.desc: A rogue pilot and his best friend team with a princess to help her save her planet when an evil space commander wants to steal all the planet's air in this "Star Wars" spoof(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Sassenach. In the series premiere of this cable drama, a married British combat nurse time-travels from World War II to 1743 Scotland, is kidnapped by Highlanders and tends to an injured young warrior(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Castle Leoch. Claire is brought to Castle Leoch under suspicion as an English spy(n)

programme.title: About Last Night
programme.desc: Danny Martin and Debbie Sullivan develop a relationship after they experience a one night stand together. Despite their friend's attempts they remain together, however things don't quite go smoothly..(n)

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: Having recovered from the grisly events of four years ago, Amity Island is once again packed with tourists. Families are sailing in the bay and swimming off the beach, but when two divers and a water-skier go missing, the local police chief fears that he is about to relive his greatest nightmare(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: The mysterious fifth element when combined with four others creates the ultimate weapon against universal evil. The story begins in 1914 when benign aliens visit an ancient Egyptian temple to steal four stones containing information about this mysterious element. The visitors promise to return to Earth in the future to save it from evil. Three centuries pass and Earth is threatened by a thunderous Cosmic Evil. Unfortunately, the Evil killed the Good aliens who promised to save the planet. Fortunately, Earthlings have a piece of one of the alien saviors. Utilizing DNA restructuring, scientists grow the piece into a perfect new alien which takes the form of a curvaceous, seductive no-holds barred redheaded acrobat who escapes from the lab with the police in hot pursuit. Desperately she dives into a cab reluctantly driven by luckless former special force officer (Bruce Willis) who suddenly finds himself faced with the task of saving the universe by finding the missing stones and vanquishing the evil forces. Featuring dazzling special effects and classy production values coupled with a healthy splash of outlandish high fashion the emphasis of Besson's film is not so much plot as it is over-the top spectacle(n)

programme.title: Cat Run
programme.desc: A wannabe chef and an unrepentant womanizer team up to start a detective agency, and quickly realize they've gotten in over their heads when their first job lands them smack in the middle of a massive government conspiracy. Anthony and his best friend, Julian, have yet to live up to their full potential. When Anthony realizes he's never going to become a five-star chef and Julian grows weary of playing the constant lothario, the two lifelong pals turn to sleuthing to make ends meet. Their first client is a smoldering top-dollar escort with evidence of a high-profile cover-up. At first they do their best to keep control of the situation, but when a shady U.S. senator comes knocking, the mob shows up guns blazing, and a most unusual assassin gets them locked in her sights, the only way to survive is to run like the devil and never look back(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: Critically acclaimed director David Gordon Green takes a break from the brooding drama that defined such early efforts as George Washington and Undertow for this action-flavored buddy comedy concerning two pot-smoking friends (Seth Rogen and James Franco) who unwittingly become involved with a vicious gang of drug dealers. Judd Apatow and Shauna Robertson produce a script co-penned by star Rogen and Evan Goldberg(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: An enormous great white shark terrorizes a summer resort town, where a police chief, a grizzled fisherman and an intrepid marine biologist realize they're "gonna need a bigger boat" to battle the bloodthirsty beast. An Oscar winner for sound, editing and John Williams' score(n)

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: Having recovered from the grisly events of four years ago, Amity Island is once again packed with tourists. Families are sailing in the bay and swimming off the beach, but when two divers and a water-skier go missing, the local police chief fears that he is about to relive his greatest nightmare(n)

programme.title: Jaws 3
programme.desc: anusA Great White shark menaces an outdoor water park that employs the grown son of a small-town police-officer who helped kill a shark that had been threatening their home town(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: Just when Mrs. Brody thought it was safe, a great white shark follows her to the Bahamas after killing her son(n)

programme.desc: Based on a novel by Elmore Leonard, this crime drama centers on a vengeful ex-con (Burt Reynolds, who also directed) as he searches for the drug lords who killed his partner while trying to start anew in Miami(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: Mexican Slayride. In the series premiere, reporter Amy Allen enlists the Team's help in locating a colleague who has disappeared in Mexico. Part 1 of two(n)

programme.title: Super Capers
programme.desc: Wonderfully wacky romp about an aspiring crimefighter (Justin Whalin) whose "[super]powers are in development" when he joins a league of hapless superheroes on a time-traveling adventure to fight the forces of evil and thwart a supervillain and his scheme to become a gold-bullion-aire. Michael Rooker, Danielle Harris, Ryan McPartlin, Doug Jones, Tom Sizemore, June Lockhart. Produced, written and directed by Ray Griggs, who costars as caped crusader "Puffer Boy."(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: An enormous great white shark terrorizes a summer resort town, where a police chief, a grizzled fisherman and an intrepid marine biologist realize they're "gonna need a bigger boat" to battle the bloodthirsty beast. An Oscar winner for sound, editing and John Williams' score(n)

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: Star-studded WWII classic, inspired by real characters and events. In the supposedly escape-proof Stalag Luft III, the Allied escape committee devise a daring plan to liberate hundreds of Allied POWs into occupied territory. Hiding civilian clothing, forged documents and three tunnels from the German guards is difficult enough, but there is also the small matter of tons of soil to dispose of. Steve McQueen's famous leap over the barbed wire on a motorcycle while being pursued by Nazi troops is one of the stand-out moments in cinema history(n)

programme.title: A Bridge Too Far
programme.desc: An all-star cast including Michael Caine, Lawrence Olivier, Sean Connery and Dirk Bogarde recreates the fateful World War II battle for Arnhem. The First Airborne Division parachutes into occupied Holland in 1944 as part of Operation Market Garden, an ambitious Allied plan to capture six Dutch bridges and cut off the Germans, but events conspire to threaten the whole operation. Based on the book by Cornelius Ryan(n)

programme.title: Solomon Kane
programme.desc: Wandering 16th-century warrior Solomon Kane renounces violence in a desperate bid to escape Satan's grasp, but he finds himself forced back into battle when a powerful evil threatens England(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A 14-year-old boy manages to foil a home invasion, but when Gibbs is called in to investigate, he suspects the teenager may be withholding crucial information. As the case makes progress, Gibbs turns his attention to helping the boy's mother, the wife of a naval officer, and his efforts result in an invitation to the White House to meet the First Lady (Michelle Obama, guest starring as herself). Meanwhile, Director Vance and FBI Agent Fornell travel to London as part of the ongoing case involving the escaped British spies.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team, alongside the FBI and MI6, continues the international manhunt for a disgraced British spy who is seeking revenge on the agents he blames for his wife's death. A re-examination of the fugitive's conviction for selling military intelligence reveals that he may have been framed - and the identity of the only person who can clear his name.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ziva's family farm in Israel is devastated by an explosion, and the former NCIS agent is reported dead. Determined to seek justice, Tony ignores orders to stay off the case and sets out to track down Trent Kort, the British national and ex-CIA agent who remains the prime suspect.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony tries to piece together the events that led to him lying wounded in a hospital bed, having been shot in the chest through his bulletproof vest. Under the guidance of therapist Dr Rachel Cranston, his memory begins to return and suspicion falls on his ex-lover EJ Barrett. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators examine the death of US marine Tommy Hill, who appears to have been fatally stabbed en route to a homecoming party thrown in his honour by his foster family. McGee and Ziva follow a trail of blood that leads them to a mobile phone, while Abby discovers the victim had been trying to hack into Virginia's state website and Ducky's autopsy reveals that Hill had been injected with a sedative.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and the team fear a gang war is about to break out when a 12-year-old boy is found murdered at a regular hangout before another two members are killed. Elsewhere, Fritz has a surprise in store for the detective. Crime drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Provenza's retired partner George Andrews returns to help the team when a case from seven years ago is reopened, but threatens to disrupt the investigation when he refuses to testify in the new trial. Detective drama series, guest starring Beau Bridges (My Name Is Earl).(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Sharon tries to help one of her female officers when she learns of her abusive marriage, while Fritz becomes increasingly annoyed at being ignored by Brenda. Detective drama, starring Mary McDonnell.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Consultant Patrick Jane uses the skills honed during his former career as a fraudulent psychic to help the California Bureau of Investigation solve crimes. In his first case, he investigates a double murder. His colleagues believe the crimes were committed by notorious serial killer Red John - but Patrick's powers of observation lead him to suspect they are the handiwork of a copycat. American drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A woman is found smothered to death in a vineyard - and although suspicion initially falls on her drug-dealer boyfriend, Jane pursues a separate line of enquiry based on the colour of the victim's hair. Reasoning that her death was caused accidentally by a would-be rapist who will inevitably be driven to strike again, he persuades Wayne, Grace and Kimball to help him catch the culprit.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The legal advisor returns to his childhood home to help a young man whose connection to the town reflects his own.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ellie is sent to Gitmo to gather evidence in the case relating to the murder of a US Navy chaplain, and while there, she is given cause to question her previous work at the NSA.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates a series of escalating threats against congresswoman Jenna Flemming, while Director Vance oversees temporary protection detail.(n)

programme.title: 48 Hours: NCIS
programme.desc: New series. Documentary in which Rocky Carroll offers viewers a step-by-step insight into the biggest cases handled by America's real-life NCIS investigators.(n)

programme.title: Baskets
programme.desc: Christine puts the money from the sale of her mother's home to use, as she takes full ownership of the rodeo. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris is named as homecoming king, but Meg learns that the cool kids plan to prank him during the ceremony, while Peter gets jealous when Cleveland starts hanging out with Jerome.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The family competes in a reality TV show, but when Stan and Hayley ditch Steve and Francine, they end up in a Tunisian labour prison.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg convinces Brian to take her SATs for her, but when she receives poor exam results everyone begins to question how smart the dog really is. Peter spends the day with the canine, showing him all the joys of being stupid, and the benefits of having a low IQ.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan decides to alleviate the stresses of his hectic family life by buying a hot tub. However, he fails to count on his new purchase having an evil agenda of its own. Animated comedy, with the voice of show creator Seth MacFarlane, and guest star Cee-Lo Green.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Crossover episode in which characters from Family Guy and The Cleveland Show end up meeting the Smiths when a storm hits the towns of Quahog, Stoolbend and Langley Falls.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Another power cut gives Peter the opportunity to regale the family with a second Star Wars-themed story, this time based on Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back. Chris, Meg, Lois, Brian and Stewie are recast in their original roles, while Mort is introduced as fan-favourite Lando Calrissian and Chris's boss Carl fills in for Yoda. With the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Seth Green and Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger becomes Steve's legal guardian, but his overzealous approach to parenting gets his adopted son's school principal fired. Meanwhile, Stan and Francine decide to make their own fun at the world's biggest water park.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan persuades his last single friend to get married so he can realise his dream of becoming a best man, but when he invites an ex-convict to the wedding, she jeopardises the event. Elsewhere, Ricky Martin causes Roger to doubt himself.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois agrees to be a surrogate mother for a friend - who promptly dies unexpectedly, leaving her facing a dilemma surrounding the future of the unborn child.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter loses his job at the Happy-Go-Lucky toy factory, but the blow is cushioned by an unexpected windfall in the form of a massive welfare payout. First-ever episode of the animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Alex Borstein and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan creates attractive alter ego Phyllis in a desperate bid to bond with his son, but when he takes things too far, Francine is forced to intervene. Elsewhere, a group of men takes advantage of Roger's new limousine service, prompting him to set out on a manhunt to exact revenge. With the guest voices of Sarah Michelle Gellar and Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: A jealous Francine tries to break up Stan's renewed relationship with a former girlfriend, only to unwittingly leave Roger at the mercy of an alien-hunter. Elsewhere, Steve accidentally wears Hayley's panties to school, and finds they bring him luck.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: When Adrian's estranged truck-driver father shows up out of the blue at Christmas after a near 40-year absence, the detective decides to join him on the road - where they stumble across a very peculiar mystery. Guest starring Dan Hedaya, with Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Three Pies.
programme.desc: Adrian's estranged brother Ambrose, an obsessive hoarder and agoraphobic, helps him investigate a typically bizarre murder involving a sack race, a bingo tournament and a cherry pie. Drama, guest starring John Turturro, with Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the TV Star.
programme.desc: An obsessed fan (Sarah Silverman) confesses to the murder of a TV star's ex-wife, but Adrian is not convinced of her guilt and sets out to ensure the culprit is brought to justice. A doctored keep-fit video provides him with the clue he needs to solve the case. Guest starring Billy Burke (The Twilight Saga).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Consultant Patrick Jane uses the skills honed during his former career as a fraudulent psychic to help the California Bureau of Investigation solve crimes. In his first case, he investigates a double murder. His colleagues believe the crimes were committed by notorious serial killer Red John - but Patrick's powers of observation lead him to suspect they are the handiwork of a copycat. American drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.desc: A woman is found smothered to death in a vineyard - and although suspicion initially falls on her drug-dealer boyfriend, Jane pursues a separate line of enquiry based on the colour of the victim's hair. Reasoning that her death was caused accidentally by a would-be rapist who will inevitably be driven to strike again, he persuades Wayne, Grace and Kimball to help him catch the culprit.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony tries to piece together the events that led to him lying wounded in a hospital bed, having been shot in the chest through his bulletproof vest. Under the guidance of therapist Dr Rachel Cranston, his memory begins to return and suspicion falls on his ex-lover EJ Barrett. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators examine the death of US marine Tommy Hill, who appears to have been fatally stabbed en route to a homecoming party thrown in his honour by his foster family. McGee and Ziva follow a trail of blood that leads them to a mobile phone, while Abby discovers the victim had been trying to hack into Virginia's state website and Ducky's autopsy reveals that Hill had been injected with a sedative.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Patrick uses controversial tactics to catch the killer of a teenage girl whose body has been found on a beach, even though his unorthodox approach risks jeopardising the entire investigation. Speculating that the victim's surfer friends may be able to reveal the truth about how she died, he announces that he is going to hypnotise them in an attempt to jog their memories - but plans a cunning double bluff.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: When a wealthy businessman is found tortured to death in the safe room of his house, the agents discover he was living a double life with a mistress. The plot thickens when the victim's daughter is kidnapped, so Patrick involves the dead man's wife and girlfriend in an audacious plan to close the case. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: Neurosurgeon Megan Hunt gets a job as a coroner in Philadelphia after a car accident leads to her quitting the operating theatre. She and her partner investigate when the body of a female jogger is found floating in a river. Pilot episode of the crime drama, starring Dana Delany.(n)

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: A man and his former sweetheart are found shot dead in a car and while police believe the male victim killed his companion then turned a gun on himself, Megan has an alternative theory. Further investigation reveals the pair were trying to rekindle their romance, which might have inflamed a domineering ex-lover. Dana Delany stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy lieutenant Paul Booth is shot dead while sitting on a park bench. It turns out that the last people he called were his boss, his wife and Penelope Langston - a rebellious academic who also happens to be McGee's grandmother. She says that the victim was an old student of hers who kept in touch, but later reveals she was recruited to work on a special project during the Vietnam War by the head of a top-secret think tank Booth was a member of. Guest starring Lily Tomlin, with Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A man who died after being knocked down by a van is revealed to be a professional hitman responsible for at least six contract killings - and his next target was to be a navy lieutenant commander. Meanwhile, Abby is delighted at being a match for a teenager who needs a kidney transplant, but she is informed that someone else with very similar DNA has also been identified as suitable. Has she found a relative she never knew about? Guest starring Brett Tucker (Neighbours).(n)

programme.title: Whacked Out Sports
programme.desc: Generally telecast on the weekend late-night schedule, the half-hour Whacked Out Sports was a reality "clip" show devoted to unusual sports activities and embarrassing bloopers. The series' specialty seemed to be spotlighting eccentric contestants indulging in offbeat sports events with bizarre rules. In each market that the series played, viewers were invited to send in video clips of "crazy stuff never seen on TV" -- especially if "hot girls" were involved (that's what it said on the press release!). Seen on the NBC-owned stations in the larger markets, Whacked Out Sports was initially broadcast on September 7, 2006(n)

programme.title: White House Down
programme.desc: A devoted father fights a ruthless paramilitary group that has seized control the White House in this high-stakes action thriller from director Roland Emmerich (2012) and writer James Vanderbilt (The Amazing Spider-Man). Dejected after being turned down for a position with the Secret Service but unable to break the news to his adoring daughter, Capitol policeman John Cale (Channing Tatum) is taking her on a tour of the White House when a powerful explosion rips through the building, sparking mass chaos. When the smoke clears, Cale learns that heavily armed rebels have taken both his daughter (Joey King) and the president (Jamie Foxx) hostage. As news of the attack creates mass panic and fear of total collapse, Cale realizes that the fate of his daughter, the Commander in Chief, and the entire nation rest in his willingness to fight back against the terrorists who have brought the most powerful nation on the planet to its knees. Maggie Gyllenhaal, Jason Clarke, Richard Jenkins, and James Woods co-star(n)

programme.desc: Black Widower. And Bart is suspicious of Sideshow's intentions; after all, he and Selma have very different opinions on MacGyver !(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge in Chains. Marge is arrested for shoplifting and when she is convicted the Simpson family find that life just isn't the same without her. Featuring the special guest voices of David Crosby and Phil Hartman as themselves(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Secrets of a Successful Marriage. Homer teaches a class on how to have a successful marriage. Unfortunately, he can't help revealing secrets about Marge and ends up in the doghouse. Well, tree house(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Who Shot Mr. Burns?. Just about everyone in Springfield vows to kill Mr Burns after he cheats the elementary school out of a newly-discovered oil well(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: 22 Short Films About Springfield. The lives of Springfield residents are highlighted in a series of interconnecting vignettes(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In Marge We Trust. Reverend Lovejoy puts Marge in charge of counseling parishioners; Homer finds his likeness is popular in Japan as the symbol for a cleaning product. Voices: Julie Kavner, Harry Shearer, Sab Shimono, Gedde Watanabe(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: King of the Hill. Two company executives hire Homer to climb Springfield's most treacherous mountain, the ominously named Murderhorn, as a promotional stunt for their product. With the guest voice of Brendan Fraser(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart the Mother. A trip to the Springfield Family Fun Center proves to be a lucky one for successful bully Nelson Muntz (voice of Nancy Cartwright) when he wins a brand new BB gun, and Bart Simpson (also voiced by Cartwright), suitably impressed, asks if he can come over some time and try it out. Bart's mother Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) is aware of Nelson's thuggish tendencies and doesn't care for guns, so she forbids Bart to spend time with Nelson. Bart stops by his house after school anyway, and while trying out the gun accidentally kills a bird. Marge arrives just in time to see Bart in action, and rather than yell at her boy, she tells him she's given up on him. Bart senses he's finally crossed a dangerous line, and when he sees several unhatched eggs in the late bird's nest, he takes the back to his tree house in order to hatch them. While Bart tries to keep the egg-hatching project a secret, when Marge finds out it gives her a new faith in her son. However, when the eggs finally hatch, to the surprise of everyone what emerges aren't birds but Bolivian Tree Lizards, which have been declared a menace to wildlife by the U.S. Wildlife Department. "Bart The Mother" featured a voice cameo from Phil Hartman as Troy McClure in what proved to be his final appearance on the show; the episode first aired on September 27, 1998(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Beyond Blunderdome. When Mel Gibson becomes convinced that Homer is the only man with the guts to tell him the truth, he insists Homer accompany him to Hollywood to help fix his newest film project, a remake of Mr. Smith Goes to Washington(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homr. An x-ray reveals that Homer has a crayon lodged in his brain that has been there since childhood. Upon removal of the crayon, Homer's IQ suddenly jumps to a very high level(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Larry, Curly and Moe work to save their childhood home, solve a murder and become reality-TV stars in this hilarious comic adventure featuring everyone's favorite knuckleheads(n)

programme.title: Carry On Nurse
programme.desc: The patients on the men's ward of Haven Hospital cause more mayhem for the staff than the rest of the hospital combined, forcing the management to send in a formidable matron to control the situation. Feeling aggrieved by her no-nonsense methods, the chaps decide the time is right to get their own back. Comedy, with Kenneth Williams, Hattie Jacques, Joan Sims, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey, Shirley Eaton and Leslie Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Antz
programme.desc: A neurotic worker ant passes himself off as a soldier to impress a princess. However, he provokes a jealously ambitious general with an accidental act of heroism - so he and his beloved decide to flee the brutal colony and go in search of the promised land of Insectopia. Animated comedy, with the voices of Woody Allen, Sharon Stone, Gene Hackman and Sylvester Stallone.(n)

programme.title: Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters
programme.desc: The modern-day teenage son of the Greek god Poseidon must lead his friends on a perilous journey into the Bermuda triangle. They need to recover the legendary Golden Fleece to save the world, but getting to it means braving all manner of terrifying monsters. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Logan Lerman and Alexandra Daddario.(n)

programme.title: Multiplicity
programme.desc: A workaholic whose demanding job often keeps him away from home hits on the idea of cloning himself so he can spend more time with his wife and kids. However, this is when his problems really begin, as the clones start to take over his house. Comedy, starring Michael Keaton, Andie MacDowell, Harris Yulin and Richard Masur.(n)

programme.title: Patti Cake$ Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Geremy Jasper and stars Danielle Macdonald, Cathy Moriarty, Bridget Everett and Siddharth Dhananjay talk about making the comedy.(n)

programme.title: Hocus Pocus
programme.desc: A teenager in Salem, Massachusetts, breaks into a spooky house on Halloween and accidentally resurrects three witches who have been dead for 300 years. The sorceresses are soon causing chaos while seeking a suitable sacrifice for a ritual to give them eternal youth. However, an old foe - a boy they turned into a cat - is on hand to help stop their mischief. Supernatural Disney comedy, with Bette Midler, Sarah Jessica Parker, Kathy Najimy and Omri Katz.(n)

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: A Brooklyn bartender secretly provides a service delivering shipments of money to local gangsters. His criminal connections lead to his involvement in a robbery that goes disastrously wrong and digs up the long-buried secrets from his neighbourhood's past. Crime drama based on a short story by Dennis Lehane, starring Tom Hardy, Noomi Rapace and James Gandolfini in his final film role.(n)

programme.title: Splice
programme.desc: Two scientists hope to create new creatures for medical purposes by combining DNA from various animals. When their funding is stopped, they secretly create a new creature incorporating human DNA. However, they soon realise they cannot control it, while the relationship between the being and its creators turns dangerous. Sci-fi horror, starring Adrien Brody, Sarah Polley and Delphine Chaneac.(n)

programme.title: Isolation
programme.desc: An Irish cattle farmer facing financial problems agrees to let a scientist carry out DNA experiments on one of his cows in exchange for money, but the sinister procedure takes a disastrous turn, unleashing a genetic nightmare that will put many lives in danger. Horror, starring John Lynch, Essie Davis, Sean Harris, Marcel lures and Crispin Letts.(n)

programme.title: BSL Zone
programme.desc: Punk Chef meets Claudia Bell whose love for takeaways is putting her health at risk.(n)

programme.title: Big Business
programme.desc: The first-born babies in two sets of identical twins are mixed up at birth by a short-sighted nurse, leading to their being raised in very different social circles. In later life, one pair, brought up in a poor mining town, visits New York to challenge a powerful conglomerate - only to find their respective siblings are in charge of the company. Comedy, starring Bette Midler and Lily Tomlin in dual roles alongside Fred Ward and Edward Herrmann.(n)

programme.title: Rango
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Spy Kids 4: All the Time in the World
programme.desc: A secret agent decides to retire after having a baby, while her two stepchildren remain completely unaware of her exciting past. They stumble on to the truth when she is recalled to duty and, with the aid of two former junior spies, they help battle an evil mastermind who has the power to control time. Family adventure, starring Jessica Alba, Jeremy Piven, Rowan Blanchard and Mason Cook.(n)

programme.title: Young Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The teenage detective and his future sidekick Watson meet for the first time at boarding school. The death of Holmes's mentor sets the youngsters on their first case, and they discover that former members of an archaeological survey team have died under suspicious circumstances - pointing to a sinister Egyptian cult using hallucinogenic poisons to kill its victims. Adventure, starring Nicholas Rowe, Alan Cox and Sophie Ward.(n)

programme.title: Little Man Tate
programme.desc: A devoted mother faces a dilemma thanks to her prodigiously talented son, who is a whiz at all things mathematical and musical - but struggles to fit in with his classmates. A psychologist intervenes, only to discover her involvement causes more problems than it solves. Drama, directed by and starring Jodie Foster, with Dianne Wiest, Adam Hann-Byrd and Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic soldier uses technology that allows him to control a genetically engineered body on a mission to a dangerous jungle world. His assignment is to infiltrate an alien tribe on behalf of a corrupt mining corporation, which wants to drive them from their land. He comes to sympathise with the natives, and helps them fight back against his employers. James Cameron's sci-fi adventure, starring Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten gets a tagine cooking lesson from teacher and chef Gail Arnold.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten creates the perfect French dinner party with a slow cooked lamb recipe, and tips on how to create the ideal setting.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten shares her favourite chocolate recipes and chocolatier Brigitte Browney reveals how to get professional results at home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares sweet and savoury rice dishes, including a jambalaya and a classic rice pudding.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree celebrates her dad's retirement with a meal of all his favourite foods, including slow-cooked burgundy beef stew and mini chocolate-cherry cakes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cooks up four sensational 16-minute meals for summer. On the menu is coriander lime salmon, a Greek feast to-go, perfect pasta with pesto and peas, and super-fast courgette noodles for a solo summertime supper.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree demonstrates three chicken dishes, including slow cooker chicken and broccoli, chicken pie and a chicken and kale caesar salad.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree and her daughter Paige reminisce over an afternoon tea for two, as they enjoy ham and leak mini quiches, garden spread finger sandwiches and lemon raspberry tarts.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. He uses the vegetables as the final touches in a spaghetti and meatball dish, as well as creating `posh beans on toast' and a spicy fritter.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents two shellfish recipes for the weekend, Jimmy Doherty prepares his own charcuterie, and the duo try to resurrect the fortunes of a long-forgotten Sussex drink called huckle-my-buff. Their guest in the cafe kitchen is TV property guru Kirstie Allsopp, who rustles up one of her favourite dishes, the Indian street food pani puri.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's taking a tasty tour through Tuscany in Italy. In Montecatini Alto, a hillside seafood spot serves up a squid ink specialty and a Mediterranean prawn-artichoke mashup.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's hitting up totally traditional Italian spots in Florence. A 50-year-old landmark is serving up a legendary spaghetti specialty and some crazy good chicken.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy's going on a flavour filled tour of Scottsdale, Arizona. He tries an Italian beef specialty, a banging brisket at a barbecue gas station, then gets crazy at a burger joint.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy tries crab stuffed flounder in Atlantic City. In Phoenix he visits a Mom and Pop pizza shop and in Bakersfield, California, he finds down-home specialties worthy of a road trip.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy's gettin' a far-out taste of both coasts as he travels from California to the Atlantic.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy's getting an authentic taste from all around the globe like Latin fusion, real-deal Thai, and Sicilian specialties.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy's taste buds are in for a culinary adventure with meaty Texas chili, decadent pumpkin pancakes, peanut butter burgers, 'Bacon Love' ice cream and a mean mole sauce.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy's visiting a town with a lot of flavour: Bakersfield, California. He goes to a Basque spot serving a four-course meal, a Greek place cooking up authentic specialties and a funky Asian joint.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy checks out high-octane joints in Charlotte, North Carolina, with NASCAR driver Clint Bowyer.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy indulges himself on righteously rich recipes in Charlotte, North Carolina, and Los Angeles.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits a Korean-Mexican mash-up and in Chinatown, a New Orleans-inspired joint. Then he heads to Charlotte, North Carolina, and a Serbian pizza place.(n)

programme.title: Bakers vs. Fakers
programme.desc: The bakers have to use beans in campfire s'mores, and Lorraine Pascale, Damiano Carrara and Damaris Phillips judge the contestants on how they handle zucchini in their dishes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents two shellfish recipes for the weekend, Jimmy Doherty prepares his own charcuterie, and the duo try to resurrect the fortunes of a long-forgotten Sussex drink called huckle-my-buff. Their guest in the cafe kitchen is TV property guru Kirstie Allsopp, who rustles up one of her favourite dishes, the Indian street food pani puri.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly, here probing a chef with a bad attitude.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of a Las Vegas bistro fears his restaurant manager, who happens to be his brother, is not doing a good job, so the Mystery Diners check up on him.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.sub-title: You Can't Be Everything To Everybody.
programme.desc: Willie helps chef AJ, who is struggling to make ends meet despite his award-winning burgers and a commitment to pleasing his customers.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie helps Anthony and Toby, owners of struggling eatery Hot Rods Real Pit BBQ, and finds that bad attitudes and a lack of training are contributing to their lack of success.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Chef Guy Fieri visits Illinois to sample a `horseshoe' sandwich, which comes piled high with eggs, meat, gravy and potatoes.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Chef Guy Fieri visits the St Louis tavern, which serves authentic international dishes like homemade German spaetzle.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a Phoenix restaurant that serves an unusual fusion of Mexican, Chinese and Caribbean food.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fierier checks out a West Virginian restaurant built into two old buses, and a Florida bar that serves dolphin sandwiches.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fierier visits Memphis, where he samples a local favourite, barbecue spaghetti.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri samples the delights of a fast food restaurant in Gilbert, Arizona, where burger and pizzas are topped with the freshest ingredients.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Na Garten shares her vegetable based recipes for main courses, starters, salads and side-dishes.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at what some chefs cook when they get home after work, with quick and easy recipes.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten cooks with Grand Pellegrino for the famous Rao's restaurant, and finds out the best kitchens in America.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten showcases a range of cheeses and the best ways to prepare them.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef prepares a meal that is fun for all ages, beginning with a fresh vegetable plate and a sweet onion dip.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef hosts a wine-maker's dinner showcasing a variety of offerings from a single winery, and invites her friend to pair each drink with a specific food dish.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Hair stylist Remo Bot loves to cook like his Mama did, which unfortunately is 75 years out of date.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond rustles up a frontier feast for her family who are hard at work building new pens on the ranch. She serves citrus-grilled pollo asado and cheesy beans.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Cowboy Josh is taking Alex on as his ranch apprentice, and Ree hopes to satisfy their big appetites by preparing supreme pizza burgers and a quick Italian salad.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While the men are out cutting down cedar trees, Ree rustles up a casual lunch of rigatoni with chicken thighs and a salad with creamy dressing.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It is a busy day on the ranch with the whole Drummond gang moving cattle, so Ree prepares lunch, making a meaty pepperoni pizza with homemade pizza sauce.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four talented cake artists compete to have their cake creation at the centre of a massive celebration for the Girl Scouts of America.(n)

programme.title: Beach Bites With Katie Lee
programme.desc: Katie Lee is on the hunt for dishes and restaurants that are off the beaten path. In Hawaii she finds mac and cheese pancakes and Pho-strami, a Vietnamese spin on a deli sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Beach Bites With Katie Lee
programme.desc: Katie Lee is toasting the gooiest of dairy delights, teaming up with her 'The Kitchen' co-host, Marcela Valladolid, for tacos in San Diego.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves simple recipes using winter vegetables grown in his Essex garden. He prepares a seasonal coleslaw and bubble and squeak, and uses homegrown cabbage to make an Italian soup.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver steers away from the tourist trails in Venice as he explores the gastronomy of the Italian city. He prepares spaghetti vongole for a group of local fishermen, is taught the art of the perfect risotto by Ruggero Bovo, samples prosecco and cooks a bellini with beef carpaccio. The chef also tries his hand at minestrone with vegetables before being joined by old friend Gennaro Contaldo to make a Venetian tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes Christmas goodies to give as gifts, including homemade gumdrops, Christmas cherries, pretzel turtles, cayenne cheese straws and sweet spicy smoky roasted almonds.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond celebrates her and her husband's anniversary by preparing a Colorado wedge salad, prime rib for five with chimichurri, and rustic country bread with honey butter.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers compete in an epic challenge, creating Star Wars-themed cakes for a huge bash celebrating Disney's Star Wars video game.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: Three contestants enter the barbecue arena, but only one will emerge victorious, winning the title of Kids BBQ Champion.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the villages surrounding Toulouse in the French Pyrenees, an area renowned for its artisan food. He goes truffle-hunting and prepares an omelette with the pickings, learns how to make bread in the traditional way, and joins locals for a wild boar hunt. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger visits Puerto Rico to try out their grilled cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger hangs out with chefs in Alexander City, Alabama, and Charleston, South Carolina, who are putting a whole new spin on rotisserie cooking in the great outdoors.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The crusading chef reaches the final stop on his tour, a Navajo reservation in Arizona. Here, he encounters some of the country's oldest culinary traditions, and is given a crash course in the tribe's spirituality. However, he is disappointed to see the extent to which Navajo children are becoming reliant on junk food, and sets out to help them embrace their heritage by introducing them to Native American versions of fast food.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Tom and Diana set out to help the local community by taking on a scheming estate agent who has got her claws into the hapless Harvey. Graham Crowden and Stephanie Cole star in the retirement home comedy.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: The ladies bowling team nickname Tom `Superstud' when Diana ends up in his bed after the residents are bequeathed £200 to get drunk at a wake. Comedy, starring Graham Crowden and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville changes his image with the help of some trendy clothes, sunglasses and a medallion made from a cocoa tin lid, while Arkwright decides to increase his profits through advertising. Comedy, with Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright thinks he has pulled a fast one by offloading a job lot of genuine Yorkshire clothes horses onto rival shopkeeper Albert Gupta - until his competitor makes a profit on them. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. Comedy with the wheeler-dealing Trotter family, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: The shopkeeping comedy returns with a festive instalment. Granville and Gastric find themselves playing marriage counsellors, while Leroy adopts a festive disguise to avoid relationship trouble of a different kind. Meanwhile, Mrs Featherstone struggles to get into the Christmas spirit and Kath attempts to bring the street together as one harmonious choir of carollers to beat Finkle Street once and for all - but does Granville have a trick up his sleeve to help them out? Starring David Jason, Tim Healy, James Baxter and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville buys a batch of devices that are supposed to create positive emotions. A local underworld boss is looking for Leroy after his latest girlfriend makes Mrs Hussein jealous, while Mrs Featherstone takes it upon herself to solve Mr Newbold's delicate problem - with the long-suffering shopkeeper's help.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Eric, Cyril and Mr Newbold try to prove they have it in them to be exciting men of action. Granville tries to shift a consignment of mints that are past their sell by date with unexpected results, and finds himself once more trying to escape the grim prospect of becoming Mrs Featherstone's fourth husband.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville finds some outdated Christmas puddings and comes up with a clever plan to lure customers into buying them. Madge is convinced that her house is haunted and refuses to sleep in her own bedroom, but Gastric's hidden spiritual powers could help solve the mystery.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to sell a huge wheel of cheese which is long past its sell by date. Leroy gets sick of delivering goods by bicycle and demands his father invest in a van - and Gastric is on hand to sell them a suitable vehicle. Mrs Featherstone makes some frightening suggestions to Mr Newbold about taking their relationship further.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: A mysterious woman comes looking for Eric, and Kath is not convinced by his claims to have no idea who she is. Granville buys a job lot of turnips, and tries to convince his customers of their remarkable medicinal qualities, and a taste of Mr Newbold's homemade wine leaves Mrs Featherstone feeling more determined than ever to find herself a fourth husband.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville changes his image with the help of some trendy clothes, sunglasses and a medallion made from a cocoa tin lid, while Arkwright decides to increase his profits through advertising. Comedy, with Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: A special training day for the staff at Wernham Hogg turns into a sing-song thanks to the insufferable Brent, and Tim decides he is wasting his time in a dead-end job. Comedy, starring Ricky Gervais and Martin Freeman.(n)

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Brent employs a new secretary - and true to form, picks the prettiest woman he can find. His worries about work experience girl Donna - namely that she has had a fling with someone else in the office - are all forgotten on a drunken night out in Slough. Comedy, starring Ricky Gervais.(n)

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Jennifer from head office arrives bearing bad news - the Slough branch is to be merged. However, Brent discovers he is guaranteed promotion to a new post, as long as he sells out his own team. Comedy, starring Ricky Gervais.(n)

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.sub-title: Hello Can I Have a Bath?.
programme.desc: Ardal O'Hanlon, Roisin Conaty, Rob Delaney and Elis James join Alan to discuss such varied subjects as being heckled by Grandmaster Flash, singing Elton John in a meditation retreat, being serenaded by Lionel Richie and taking part in a bank robbery.(n)

programme.title: Memoirs of an Invisible Man
programme.desc: A successful but bored stockbroker receives an unexpected boost after he is made accidentally invisible in a scientific experiment. Unfortunately, he now has to go on the run from devious CIA agents who are determined to use him in their own nefarious schemes. Comedy spy thriller directed by John Carpenter, starring Chevy Chase, Daryl Hannah, Sam Neill, Michael McKean and Stephen Tobolowsky.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Dixon Bainbridge announces his intention to demolish the zoo to build a road, so Howard and Vince embark on a perilous journey into the Jungle Room to find the only man who can save them - missing adventurer Tommy Nookah. But first they have to get past a pack of wolves, which proves far more complicated than anticipated.(n)

programme.title: A Sharp Intake of Breath
programme.desc: Peter is off his food, so Sheila insists he goes to the doctor for a check-up. Guest starring Richard Wilson.(n)

programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. Comedy with the wheeler-dealing Trotter family, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to persuade Arkwright to buy a van, so he does not have to struggle with the shop's outdated delivery bike. He is pleasantly surprised when his skinflint uncle agrees - until he takes the vehicle out on the road. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: The shopkeeping comedy returns with a festive instalment. Meanwhile, Mrs Featherstone struggles to get into the Christmas spirit and Kath attempts to bring the street together as one harmonious choir of carollers to beat Finkle Street once and for all - but does Granville have a trick up his sleeve to help them out? Starring David Jason, Tim Healy, James Baxter and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Another chance to see the 2012 contest, as presenters Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins invite 12 enthusiastic bakers to take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur, facing challenges devised by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. To begin with, they tackle an upside down cake, before following Paul's recipe for rum babas, a hybrid of cake and enriched dough that baffles some of the competitors. Finally, they are challenged to produce a show-stopping cake that reveals a hidden design when sliced into. Who will be first to leave?.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining amateur bakers face three tasks designed to test their bread-making skills, beginning by preparing two varieties of flatbread for judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. The hopefuls then tackle a demanding technical challenge as they try to replicate Paul's recipe for an eight-strand plaited loaf, before receiving the dubious honour of becoming the first contestants in the show's history to make bagels. At the end of the day, Paul and Mary must decide who is this round's Star Baker - and who will be going home. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 10 remaining amateur cooks' tart-making abilities are put to the test in the third round of the competition. Their first task is to bake a tarte Tatin, with judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry looking for intriguing flavour combinations to tickle their tastebuds. The hopefuls then face another daunting technical challenge as they try to replicate Mary's seemingly straightforward recipe for treacle tart, but the delicate task of adding a lattice top leaves some contestants flummoxed. Finally, they try to create an ornate fruit tart fit for gracing the window display of a leading patisserie - before discovering the identities of the latest Star Baker and the person who will be heading home. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood assess the remaining contestants' dessert-making skills. The hopefuls start by creating tortes before tackling this week's technical test - the delicate French dish of creme caramel. Though these two rounds provide a stern examination of the amateurs' creative flair and technical ability, they then face possibly the toughest task of the series so far - a six-hour challenge to create a show-stopping layered meringue. Once the sugar has set, who will be this week's Star Baker, and who will be going home? Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants' pie-making skills are put to the test in a trio of demanding tasks. First, the hopefuls try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry by making beef Wellington, before creating hand-raised pies during this round's technical challenge - but several of the cooks run into difficulties as they try to work with a pastry dolly for the first time. Finally, the showstopper challenge sees traditional American pies being prepared - before one more baker is eliminated from the competition. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The pressure continues to rise as the contestants' pudding-making skills face a stern examination. Their first task involves creating a pair of sponge dishes, before Mary Berry sets the latest technical challenge - recreating her recipe for the meringue-topped dessert queen of puddings. Finally the cooks try to get to grips with the intricacies of baking strudel in the showstopper round - before one of them leaves the competition for good. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The contestants are tasked with creating signature buns from their home regions, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins reveal the latest technical challenge - recreating Paul Hollywood's recipe for jam doughnuts. The showstopper task sees them baking an enriched dough loaf fit for a grand celebration, before the judges decide which bakers haven't quite risen to the challenge. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The quarter-final of the competition sees the remaining amateur bakers tackle biscuit-based challenges. Their first task involves making a large batch of crispbreads - each of which must come up to Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood's exacting standards - before the technical challenge, in which they battle time and temperature to create a set of six chocolate teacakes. The last round sees the hopefuls baking and assembling a gingerbread house, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins reveal who has qualified for the 2012 semi-final - and who is going home.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Four bakers remain in the hunt for the title of Britain's best amateur baker, but they all need to raise their game when they tackle a trio of classic patisserie confections in the semi-final. A petits fours-making challenge provides an early test of nerves, before the quartet face the toughest technical task in the show's history - creating a fraisier, a sponge cake filled with mousse and strawberries. As tempers rise and confidence falters, the contestants have one last chance to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry by baking a showstopping choux gateau - before discovering who has earned a place in the 2012 final. Presented by Sue Perkins and Mel Giedroyc.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: After weeks of pastries, cakes and sponges, collapsing gingerbread houses and dodgy doughnuts, there are only three remaining bakers. But only one can be crowned the winner, and to prove they have what it takes the finalists face their most demanding challenges yet. Over two days, they must create a perfect pithivier, or puff-pastry pie, before making fondant fancies and their last showstopper - the notoriously difficult chiffon sponge. Only then will judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry decide who deserves the 2012 title. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)
