programme.title: Floyd on Britain and Ireland
programme.desc: Keith finishes off his tour in the Orkney Islands, where he makes Orcadian fish soup and samples a local cheese. His final stop is the island of Stronsay for a Ceilidh celebration and a brew of Bridges Cog.(n)

programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
programme.desc: The chef travels around America where he samples the country's best national dishes and homegrown wines.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall shows a house full of female students how to prepare dishes using cheap, sustainable seafood, demonstrating home-made fish suppers and Thai curries. He also creates recipes using a tin of sardines and employs fish-shaped moulds to make a champagne and strawberry jelly for a dinner party.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The four finalists have one hour and fifteen minutes to create a dish without meat, fish or poultry in the invention test set by Marcus Wareing, Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace. After tasting their dishes, the judges whittle their number down to three. The remaining chefs are then sent to Italy, where they cook under Enrico Crippa at the three Michelin-starred Piazzo Duomo, before preparing a six-course tasting menu for specially invited guests and the judges.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: The hopefuls compete in the final challenge, preparing two of their own recipes to be judged by Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry before the winner is announced. Presented by Aaron Craze.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by fellow Michelin-starred chef Raymond Blanc to cook two dishes using ingredients that have fallen out of favour. Raymond recreates a favourite souffle from his childhood using semolina and heritage apples vying for favour against the host's old-fashioned mutton chops with cabbage and turnip gratin. Plus, Oliver Peyton reports on a distilling revival.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver makes spinach and feta filo pie, coated ice-cream and two salads - one cucumber, the other tomato - as he demonstrates how to cook quick meals using fresh ingredients.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver shows how to cook oozy mushroom risotto with spinach salad, and lemon and raspberry cheesecake, all in 30 minutes.(n)

programme.title: Gizzi Erskine Seoul Food
programme.desc: Gizzi visits a farm that produces some of the finest beef in the world and discovers the secrets of the popular Korean beef dish, bulgogi.(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Underworld hipster Chili Palmer is back in the entertainment business in this sequel to the 1995 hit Get Shorty, which like the first film is based on a novel by Elmore Leonard. Gangster-turned-movie producer Chili (once again played by John Travolta) has grown tired of the screen trade, especially after his latest project turned out to be a box-office flop. Chili is looking for new horizons and thinks he may have found his niche when his close friend Tommy Athens (James Woods), a fellow mobster who runs an independent record label, is murdered by Russian gangsters. Chili takes over Athens' record company, Nothing to Lose Records, and begins courting Tommy's girlfriend, Edie (Uma Thurman). Edie is an experienced hand in record production, and together she and Chili spot what would seem to be the ideal act for their label -- Linda Moon (Christina Milian), a beautiful young woman with a powerhouse voice. Linda is stuck, however, in a going-nowhere R&B trio managed by the monumentally sleazy Raji (Vince Vaughn). Chili isn't much concerned about Linda's contract with Raji, but Raji certainly is, and the manager soon takes out a contract on Chili with the same Russian hoods who killed Tommy. Soon Chili is facing all the action he can handle between the Russian gunmen, a music mogul named Nick Carr (Harvey Keitel) who wants Chili to stay out of the business, and Sin LaSalle (Cedric the Entertainer), a successful hip-hop producer who wants Chili to pay him the 300,000 dollars he is owed by Tommy. Be Cool also features appearances by The Rock as a gay Samoan bodyguard, Andre Benjamin (aka Andre 3000 from the hip-hop duo Outkast) as a rapper who isn't very good with a gun, and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler as himself(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Traditionally, angels are supposed to have snowy wings, spotless flowing robes and be bathed in heavenly light, but not Michael (John Travolta). With a hairy pot belly, long hair, a cigarette addiction, an insatiable sugar craving and filthy wings, the archangel Michael is anything but angelic looking. His unkempt appearance and the fact that he is found holed up in a ramshackle boarding house in a beat-up Iowa backwater, makes it even harder to believe that he is anything but a bum. Still when the publisher of the National Mirror, the country's top tabloid learns there may be an angel afoot, he sends three reporters out to cover the story. Slightly embittered writer Frank Quinlan (William Hurt) hopes the story will bust him out of his slump. Hapless photographer Huey (Robert Pastorelli) worries that one more botched job will cause publisher Vartan Malt (Bob Hoskins) to take away his one lucrative gig shooting celebrity wonder-dog Sparky. The enigmatic Dorothy (Andie MacDowell) is supposedly an expert on all things angelic. Together the disparate trio travel to Iowa and meet Pansy Millbank (Jean Stapleton) the aged owner of a run-down rooming house who tells them how Michael miraculously saved her from financial ruin. In return, she allows him to stay at her place. Naturally, the reporters want to meet this phenomenon, but they are ill-prepared at what groggily stumps down the stairs to greet them. From the stubble-faced, boxer-short wearing, smouldering mess before them, they learn that all high-ranking angels are allowed 26 Earthly vacations for all eternity. This is Michael's final vacation and he wants to have fun. The reporters only want to get as much publicity as they can from their ethereal visitor and so set off with him to Chicago. Along the way, they have many funny misadventures(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: Screenwriter Nicholas Kazan and director Michael Apted combine elements of the hit films Sleeping With the Enemy and Double Jeopardy in this domestic thriller starring actress and recording artist Jennifer Lopez. "J. Lo" stars as Slim, a working-class diner waitress who accepts a date with the dashing Mitch (Bill Campbell), a successful building contractor who warns her about the insincere attentions of another suitor. Swept off her feet by Mitch, Slim soon marries him and gives birth to a daughter, Gracie (Tessa Allen). Her new life of suburban privilege seems idyllic for a few years until Slim discovers that Mitch is a serial philanderer. After his abuse becomes physical, Slim first seeks refuge with a battered woman's group then creates a new identity in another city, but she soon learns that there is no hiding from the resourceful Mitch, who is always able to track her down. After receiving little help from the father (Fred Ward), who abandoned her years ago, or the unsympathetic legal system, Slim resorts to martial arts lessons and a calculated campaign of payback designed to rid her and Gracie of the violent Mitch's presence forever. Enough co-stars Juliette Lewis, Noah Wyle, and Dan Futterman(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Jackie'

Kennedy, in 1963. The film stars Natalie Portman, Greta Gerwig and Peter Sarsgaard, and is directed by Pablo Larraín(n)

Gangster-turned-movie producer Chili (once again played by John Travolta) has grown tired of the screen trade, especially after his latest project turned out to be a box-office flop. Chili is looking for new horizons and thinks he may have found his niche when his close friend Tommy Athens (James Woods), a fellow mobster who runs an independent record label, is murdered by Russian gangsters. Chili takes over Athens' record company, Nothing to Lose Records, and begins courting Tommy's girlfriend, Edie (Uma Thurman). Edie is an experienced hand in record production, and together she and Chili spot what would seem to be the ideal act for their label -- Linda Moon (Christina Milian), a beautiful young woman with a powerhouse voice. Linda is stuck, however, in a going-nowhere R&B trio managed by the monumentally sleazy Raji (Vince Vaughn). Chili isn't much concerned about Linda's contract with Raji, but Raji certainly is, and the manager soon takes out a contract on Chili with the same Russian hoods who killed Tommy. Soon Chili is facing all the action he can handle between the Russian gunmen, a music mogul named Nick Carr (Harvey Keitel) who wants Chili to stay out of the business, and Sin LaSalle (Cedric the Entertainer), a successful hip-hop producer who wants Chili to pay him the 300,000 dollars he is owed by Tommy. Be Cool also features appearances by The Rock as a gay Samoan bodyguard, Andre Benjamin (aka Andre 3000 from the hip-hop duo Outkast) as a rapper who isn't very good with a gun, and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler as himself(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: Episode 1. The series opens in Tampa, as former Heisman winner Jameis Winston, outspoken free agent DeSean Jackson and Pro Bowler Gerald McCoy join rookies and free agents in the first week of drills at the Buccaneers' training camp(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: Episode 2. Jameis Winston works with his receiver tandem; and players and coaches get game-time action vs. the Bengals(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: A true story about Frank Abagnale Jr., who, before his 19th birthday, fraudulently obtained millions of dollars in cheques while posing as a Pan Am pilot, doctor, and legal prosecutor(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A math genius works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations in this intelligent thriller. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, he agrees to help an accounting clerk look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated(n)

programme.title: The Dark Knight
programme.desc: In this sequel, Batman and idealistic DA Harvey Dent join forces to arrest and prosecute Gotham City's crime lords. But the deranged Joker raises the stakes by declaring all-out war on the forces of law and order(n)

programme.desc: Death Is the Enemy. Jon's mission continues north of the wall, but the odds against his ragged band of misfits may be greater than he imagined(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Huntsman: Winter's War'
programme.desc: A look at "The Huntsman: Winter's War," a 2016 prequel to "Snow White and the Huntsman" that follows the Huntsman and his secret lover Sara as they attempt to stop Freya the Ice Queen and her evil sister from conquering the forest. The film stars Chris Hemsworth, Charlize Theron and Emily Blunt, and is directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.title: Top Ten Monks
programme.desc: A profile of the Cistercian monks at the Stift Heiligenkreuz Abbey, a 12th-century monastery near Vienna, who became a worldwide musical sensation after releasing a chart-topping album of Gregorian chants in 2008(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: In an alternate Victorian Age world, a group of famous contemporary fantasy, SF and adventure characters team up on a secret mission(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: After an attempted assassination on Ambassador Han, Lee and Carter head to Paris to protect a French woman with knowledge of the Triads' secret leaders(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Traditionally, angels are supposed to have snowy wings, spotless flowing robes and be bathed in heavenly light, but not Michael (John Travolta). With a hairy pot belly, long hair, a cigarette addiction, an insatiable sugar craving and filthy wings, the archangel Michael is anything but angelic looking. His unkempt appearance and the fact that he is found holed up in a ramshackle boarding house in a beat-up Iowa backwater, makes it even harder to believe that he is anything but a bum. Still when the publisher of the National Mirror, the country's top tabloid learns there may be an angel afoot, he sends three reporters out to cover the story. Slightly embittered writer Frank Quinlan (William Hurt) hopes the story will bust him out of his slump. Hapless photographer Huey (Robert Pastorelli) worries that one more botched job will cause publisher Vartan Malt (Bob Hoskins) to take away his one lucrative gig shooting celebrity wonder-dog Sparky. The enigmatic Dorothy (Andie MacDowell) is supposedly an expert on all things angelic. Together the disparate trio travel to Iowa and meet Pansy Millbank (Jean Stapleton) the aged owner of a run-down rooming house who tells them how Michael miraculously saved her from financial ruin. In return, she allows him to stay at her place. Naturally, the reporters want to meet this phenomenon, but they are ill-prepared at what groggily stumps down the stairs to greet them. From the stubble-faced, boxer-short wearing, smouldering mess before them, they learn that all high-ranking angels are allowed 26 Earthly vacations for all eternity. This is Michael's final vacation and he wants to have fun. The reporters only want to get as much publicity as they can from their ethereal visitor and so set off with him to Chicago. Along the way, they have many funny misadventures(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: Screenwriter Nicholas Kazan and director Michael Apted combine elements of the hit films Sleeping With the Enemy and Double Jeopardy in this domestic thriller starring actress and recording artist Jennifer Lopez. "J. Lo" stars as Slim, a working-class diner waitress who accepts a date with the dashing Mitch (Bill Campbell), a successful building contractor who warns her about the insincere attentions of another suitor. Swept off her feet by Mitch, Slim soon marries him and gives birth to a daughter, Gracie (Tessa Allen). Her new life of suburban privilege seems idyllic for a few years until Slim discovers that Mitch is a serial philanderer. After his abuse becomes physical, Slim first seeks refuge with a battered woman's group then creates a new identity in another city, but she soon learns that there is no hiding from the resourceful Mitch, who is always able to track her down. After receiving little help from the father (Fred Ward), who abandoned her years ago, or the unsympathetic legal system, Slim resorts to martial arts lessons and a calculated campaign of payback designed to rid her and Gracie of the violent Mitch's presence forever. Enough co-stars Juliette Lewis, Noah Wyle, and Dan Futterman(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Jackie'
programme.desc: A look at "Jackie," a 2016 drama about former first lady Jacqueline Onassis from her time in the White House to the aftermath of the assassination of her husband, President John F. Kennedy, in 1963. The film stars Natalie Portman, Greta Gerwig and Peter Sarsgaard, and is directed by Pablo Larraín(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Mild-mannered accountant Calvin (Kevin Hart) is stunned when he runs into an old high-school classmate named Bob (Dwayne Johnson) -- once an overweight and frequently bullied teen, Bob is now a CIA agent who's in perfect shape. However, their reignited friendship turns dangerous when Bob asks for Calvin's help with a crucial mission involving the hacking of U.S. spy satellites. Directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber (We're the Millers)(n)

programme.desc: Hella LA. Issa's newfound confidence is shaken at a day party; Molly has an eventful reunion with a childhood friend; Lawrence's trip to the grocery store turns into a wild and crazy night(n)

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: When Ron Kovic went to fight in Vietnam, his fellow Americans were waving flags; when he returned, paralysed from the mid chest down, they were burning them. He still loved his country. But America no longer loved him. Ron must find the courage to create a new life when the world of his youth has been shattered beyond repair(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: When Kate dies in a bizarre accident on her wedding day, her spirit lingers, determined to stop her grieving fiancé from moving on(n)

programme.title: Rules Don't Apply
programme.desc: In 1958 Hollywood, a romance blossoms between a pious actress and a right-wing chauffeur—even though both of them work for reclusive billionaire Howard Hughes, who forbids his employees to date each other. Their secret liaison plays out while Hughes' aviation innovations keep pace with his debilitating eccentricities(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Ride and Die. A key owner's blessing to bring professional football to Las Vegas hinges on equally critical meetings for Spencer and Joe. Meanwhile, Ricky stages his own private workout after being spurned by his new teammates; Vernon seeks a second chance; and tensions escalate between Charles and Larry after a Kisan's tryout(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Hella LA. Issa's newfound confidence is shaken at a day party; Molly has an eventful reunion with a childhood friend; Lawrence's trip to the grocery store turns into a wild and crazy night(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: The nations of Earth band together to fight off a second alien invasion, 20 years after the first attack brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered extraterrestrial technology, the alliance readies itself for a massive war(n)

programme.title: George Lopez: The Wall, Live from Washington D.C.
programme.desc: Comedian George Lopez performs in Washington, D.C., at the Kennedy Center. Topics include organic food, dogs in strollers and food allergies(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
programme.desc: This spin-off of the Harry Potter franchise jumps back in time to explore the wizarding world of 1926 New York, which is being threatened by both mystical acts of destruction and a group of extremist No-Majs (the American term for Muggles, i.e. those unable to use magic). Author Newt Scamander (Eddie Redmayne) arrives in the city as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but he gets caught up in this conflict when some of the magical creatures in his care are accidentally released. Katherine Waterston, Alison Sudol, Dan Fogler, Colin Farrell, Ezra Miller, and Johnny Depp co-star in this fantasy adventure, which was directed by David Yates (who helmed four of the Harry Potter films) and adapted for the screen by J.K. Rowling from her own book(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Dragonstone. In the Season 7 premiere, Jon organizes the defense of the North, but Sansa is concerned that his sole focus on the White Walkers could come back to haunt him. Meanwhile, Sam uncovers a vital piece of information at the Citadel that could help the North's cause; Cersei and Jaime face an uphill battle securing meaningful alliances; and Daenerys comes home(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Stormborn. Daenerys and her new advisers map out a strategy to conquer Westeros, and a surprise visitor counsels her to summon Jon Snow to Dragonstone. Meanwhile, a reunion in the Riverlands causes Arya to change course; Cersei continues her desperate search for allies; and Sam thinks he's found a cure for a deadly ailment(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Queen's Justice. Daenerys holds court; Cersei returns a gift; Jaime learns from his mistakes(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Spoils of War. Latest episode of the hit series(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Eastwatch. Daenerys demands loyalty from the surviving Lannister soldiers; Jon heeds Bran's warning about White Walkers on the move; Cersei vows to vanquish anyone or anything that stands in her way(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Erin Brockovich is an unemployed single mother, desperate to find a job, but is having no luck.While no one takes her seriously, with her trashy clothes and earthy manners, that soon changes when she begins to investigate a suspicious real estate case involving the Pacific Gas & Electric Company. What she discovers is that the company is trying quietly to buy land that was contaminated by hexavalent chromium, and, in turn, poisoning the residents in the area. As she digs deeper, Erin finds herself leading point in a series of events that would involve her lawfirm in one of the biggest class action lawsuits in American history against a multi-billion dollar corporation(n)

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: A cynical, immature young man is taught how to act like a grown-up by a little boy(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: A lonely writer falls for his computer's operating system in this quirky and endearing romance. Meanwhile, as the perceptive software draws him out of his shell, he struggles with a difficult divorce from his childhood sweetheart(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: Two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: In this suspense-filled horror film, two siblings uncover a harrowing secret about their grandparents while spending a week at their remote Pennsylvania farm(n)

programme.title: Nights in Rodanthe
programme.desc: A doctor is en route to reconcile with his estranged son when his benevolent mission is sidelined upon checking into a North Carolina beach-town inn. When the doctor arrives at the inn, he enters into a passionate affair with an unhappily married woman who is currently considering divorce. Network Television Premiere(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: Funny and perceptive comedy-drama about the trials and tribulations of parenthood, focussing on four different families all within one extended clan, with Steve Martin heading the cast as an over-protective father having problems with his anxious son. Great turns from everybody else in the huge and impressive cast(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Matt Damon, Ben Affleck and Robin Williams star in Gus Van Sant's Oscar-winning film, with Damon as Will Hunting, a school janitor who also happens to be a savant with a photographic memory and the ability to solve seemingly impossible math problems. 'Caught' at the blackboard by teacher Stellan Skarsgard (Gerald Launbeau) at the same time as he faces problems with the police, Damon is offered a choice - prison or counselling with an equally stubborn therapist (Robin Williams). From their sessions comes the film's drama as Damon is forced to deal with the tensions between his blue collar present and his potential future(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This re-imagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: Making 'Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising'
programme.desc: A look at "Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising," a sequel to the 2014 comedy that finds a young couple plagued by yet another Greek menace: the sisters of Kappa Kappa Nu. The film stars Seth Rogen, Zac Efron and Chloë Grace Moretz, and is directed by Nicholas Stoller(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: Comedy starring and co-written by Ice Cube, who plays a young street dweller who struggles to avoid the dangerous pitfalls - drugs, gang-related warfare and death - on the streets of South Central Los Angeles(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: In this intriguing dramedy, an investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Enthralling biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.desc: Funny and perceptive comedy-drama about the trials and tribulations of parenthood, focussing on four different families all within one extended clan, with Steve Martin heading the cast as an over-protective father having problems with his anxious son. programme.desc: Elizabeth Perkins and Kevin Bacon as reporters who become romantic combatants(n)

programme.desc: Comedian Tig Notaro performs at the Wilbur Theatre in Boston. Topics include doing shows in Las Vegas; introducing her fiancée to her family in Mississippi; TSA screenings; small planes; Santa Claus; and misleading text messages. Taped May 31, 2015(n)

Olivia Williams, Seymour Cassel, Brian Cox, Mason Gamble(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting

'Caught' at the blackboard by teacher Stellan Skarsgard (Gerald Launbeau) at the same time as he faces problems with the police, Damon is offered a choice - prison or counselling with an equally stubborn therapist (Robin Williams). From their sessions comes the film's drama as Damon is forced to deal with the tensions between his blue collar present and his potential future(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: John Farley (Sean William Scott) has overcome years of childhood and teenage humiliation and has fashioned himself into a self-help author who guides others towards releasing their painful memories and rebuilding their self-esteem. However, his miserable past sneaks up on him when he returns to his hometown only to find that his mother is marrying Mr. Woodcock (Billy Bob Thornton), the tough gym teacher who was the source of his school years' woes. Determined to stop his mother from marrying the man who made school a living hell for him, John is going to need all the self-help he can get. The cast of this outrageous comedy is rounded up by Susan Sarandon, Amy Poehler and Ethan Suplee(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple discover that their hospitable new neighbors are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: In 1925, an enterprising pro football player convinces America's too-good-to-be-true college football hero to play for his team and keep the league from going under(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Meg Ryan, Eva Mendes and Annette Bening head an all-female cast in this comedy drama about a woman whose life begins to unravel when she learns her husband has cheated on her(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers

This leads to the eldest teen, Sue Ellen, scamming her way into taking a job at a hip Los Angeles fashion company to feed and support her needy siblings(n)

Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar, Ritchie Coster, Peter Stormare(n)

programme.title: The Boss

programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: The lives of a kooky collection of Miami residents interconnect in this adaptation of humorist Dave Barry's novel. A high-school boy accidentally crosses paths with two hitmen hunting a crooked businessman. Chaos ensues as the boy, the hitmen, two confused cops, two petty robbers, and the Russian mob all get tangled up with one another(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: Whimsical afterlife fantasy in which a middle-aged man, killed in a car crash, is asked to justify his life and explain the scantiness of his few acts of bravery and selflessness. Judgement City is a limbo where lives are assessed by an independent tribunal who decide whether the recently deceased are eligible for Heaven. While awaiting the decision that may alter the course of his death, he falls in love with a fellow defendant(n)

programme.title: Introducing the Dwights
programme.desc: An already-unstable household becomes a virtual battle zone when the son of a risqué comedienne and a has-been singer finds mom meddling in his love life in director Cherie Nowlan's dysfunctional romantic comedy. Twenty-one-year-old Tim Dwight (Khan Chittenden) comes from a peculiar family; his mother, Jean (Brenda Blethyn), is a bawdy stage comic renowned for her scatological sense of humor and his father, John (Frankie J. Holden), is a faded country-music star who now works as a low-rent security guard. While dad is busy trying to revive his flat-lined career, mom spends most of her time doting on Tim and his developmentally disabled brother, Mark (Richard Wilson). Upon meeting the beautiful Jill (Emma Booth), Tim believes his may have finally found the woman of his dreams. Unfortunately in Jean's eyes there is only room for one woman in Tim's life, and that woman is his mother. As Tim's relationship with Jill grows increasingly serious, the stage is set for a battle royal between the woman who once gave him life and the prospective mother of his future children(n)

programme.title: K-PAX
programme.desc: (2001) a man (Kevin Spacey) found wandering at New York Central Station is taken into psychiatric care because he claims to be Prot from the planet K-PAX, "1000 of your light years away". Psychiatrist Dr. Mark Powell (Jeff Bridges) doesn't believe him and tries to unlock the trauma, but as Prot reveals knowledge that only a handful of astronomers could know and shows an uncanny knack for helping his fellow patients heal, even Powell begins to wonder. Then, clues that Prot lets slip under hypnosis lead Powell to a more earthly explanation, or so he thinks, in Iain Softley's assured, gripping sci-fi fantasy(n)

programme.title: Flipped
programme.desc: A young schoolboy realizes that the same girl he struggled to avoid may actually be his one true love in this coming-of-age romantic comedy from director Rob Reiner. Adapted from the book by Wendelin Van Draanen, Flipped tells the story of mischievous schoolboy Bryce (Callan McAuliffe) and his neighbor Juli (Madeline Carroll), who's had a crush on her girl-phobic classmate since second grade. Over the course of six years, Juli pines for Bryce as he does everything in his power to put her off. Later, as the pair enters junior high, Bryce discovers girls and the tide starts to shift. But will Juli still be interested after all that Bryce has done to keep her at arm's length? Rebecca De Mornay, Aidan Quinn, Anthony Edwards, and Penelope Ann Miller co-star(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

programme.desc: In this sequel to 101 Dalmatians, Cruella de Vil is out of prison and seemingly a changed woman. Unable to resist temptation, the evil Cruella promptly teams up with an OTT French designer in an attempt to create the ultimate dalmatian puppy coat - this time with a hood(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
programme.desc: This spin-off of the Harry Potter franchise jumps back in time to explore the wizarding world of 1926 New York, which is being threatened by both mystical acts of destruction and a group of extremist No-Majs (the American term for Muggles, i.e. those unable to use magic). Author Newt Scamander (Eddie Redmayne) arrives in the city as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but he gets caught up in this conflict when some of the magical creatures in his care are accidentally released. Katherine Waterston, Alison Sudol, Dan Fogler, Colin Farrell, Ezra Miller, and Johnny Depp co-star in this fantasy adventure, which was directed by David Yates (who helmed four of the Harry Potter films) and adapted for the screen by J.K. Rowling from her own book(n)

Visionary director Shane Acker expands his Oscar-winning animated short into a full-length feature with this adventure about a group of rag dolls battling an army of robots in a postapocalyptic world(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A math genius works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations in this intelligent thriller. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, he agrees to help an accounting clerk look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated(n)

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: Cool jazz drama from Spike Lee . Band leader Bleek Gilliam plays the horn like a dream but playing two women is a nightmare that creates friction with his ambitious sax player Shadow. Branford Marsalis provides the score(n)

programme.title: Phantasm II
programme.desc: Sequel in which two young men find themselves up against a horrifying plot by the Tall Man to capture both dead and sleeping people and turn them into ugly gnome-like creatures(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: No-one knows why thousands of New Yorkers are committing suicide. Teacher Elliot Moore and his family flee the city in search of answers(n)

programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: A Wall Street player (Christian Bale) basks in his late-1980s rich lifestyle, but behind his slick appearance lurks a murderous monster(n)

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: Action fantasy in which the Caped Crusader returns to face a dangerous coalition of arch-enemies intent on his destruction. Aided and abetted by Robin and Batgirl, Batman must confront Mr Freeze, a cold-hearted villain who has teamed up with the deadly Poison Ivy, and foil their plan to conquer the entire world(n)

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Directors Eduardo Sanchez and Daniel Myrick prove that it doesn't take a big budget and special effects to make a blockbuster horror film. Their debut feature revolves around three students making a film about the legend of a vengeful 18th-century witch, and it became a pop-culture phenomenon by presenting itself as a "real" documentary. Heather Donahue, Michael Williams, Joshua Leonard(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Mild-mannered scientist Bruce Banner has been traveling the globe in search of the antidote that will allow him to break free from his primal alter ego, but both the warmongers who long to exploit him for their own gain and a horrific creature known as The Abomination are determined to stop him from achieving his noble goal in Transporter 2 director Louis Leterrier's take on the classic Marvel Comics superhero tale. For years, Bruce (Edward Norton) has been living in the shadows, pursued by the military and haunted by the rage within. But traveling the world in secrecy isn't easy, and as hard as he tries Bruce can't get Betty Ross (Liv Tyler) off his mind. The daughter of Bruce's nemesis Gen. Thaddeus "Thunderbolt" Ross (William Hurt), Betty represents everything that is beautiful in the world to a man who lives his life on the run. Eventually, Bruce returns to civilization and faces the wrath of The Abomination. While the Hulk may be a formidable force of nature, The Abomination is decidedly more powerful, and determined to destroy Bruce Banner. Created when KGB agent Emil Blonsky (Tim Roth) exposed himself to a higher dose of the same radiation that transformed Bruce into The Hulk, The Abomination is unable to change back into human form and holds Bruce accountable for his frightful condition. With time fast running out for both Bruce and The Hulk, New York City is about to become the ultimate urban battle zone as two of the most powerful creatures ever to walk the earth clash in a massive, no-holds-barred fight to the finish(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Mild-mannered accountant Calvin (Kevin Hart) is stunned when he runs into an old high-school classmate named Bob (Dwayne Johnson) -- once an overweight and frequently bullied teen, Bob is now a CIA agent who's in perfect shape. However, their reignited friendship turns dangerous when Bob asks for Calvin's help with a crucial mission involving the hacking of U.S. spy satellites. Directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber (We're the Millers)(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two unruly brothers (Zac Efron and Adam DeVine) are forced to find dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii by their parents, who hope that a couple of nice gals will keep their wild behavior under control. However, a pair of hard-partying ladies (Anna Kendrick and Aubrey Plaza) see a viral video in which they plead for dates, and decide to pretend to be the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip. Directed by Jake Szymanski(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: After an attempted assassination on Ambassador Han, Lee and Carter head to Paris to protect a French woman with knowledge of the Triads' secret leaders(n)

programme.title: Chasing Papi
programme.desc: A brisk pace and a strong cast fuel this spirited romantic farce. An executive (Eduardo Verastegui) from L.A. romances three women at the same time---a vibrant Miami waitress, a Manhattan debutante and a brainy Chicago lawyer. But the womanizer's happy world shatters when all three women visit him and discover his infidelity. Roselyn Sanchez, Sofia Vergara, Jaci Velasquez(n)

programme.title: Closed Circuit
programme.desc: A major terrorism trial ensnares two ex-lovers who both play crucial roles on the defense team in this gripping thriller. When the lead defense attorney dies, his replacement proves to be the former lover of a Special Advocate with clearance to view classified evidence(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his friend decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various hit movies(n)

programme.title: Book of Shadows: Blair Witch 2
programme.desc: In this eerie sequel to "The Blair Witch Project," the town of Burkittsville, Md., has now become world famous. Among the tourists are five young adults who decide to take things a step further by heading into the woods with their own camera equipment. Stephen Baker Turner, Tristen Skyler, Erica Leerhsen. Directed by Joe Berlinger(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: The nations of Earth band together to fight off a second alien invasion, 20 years after the first attack brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered extraterrestrial technology, the alliance readies itself for a massive war(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: Kicked out of a successful metal group 20 years previously, Robert 'Fish' Fishman gets a second chance at fame when he joins his nephew's band(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels director Guy Ritchie heads back to the London underworld for this hyperkinetic crime comedy concerning a shady land deal that leaves every schemer in the city determined to get rich or die trying. When a Russian mobster orchestrates a lucrative real estate scam, every criminal in London wants a piece of the action. Greed is the universal language, and everyone from unrelenting crime boss Lenny Cole (Tom Wilkinson) to street-smart criminal One Two (Gerard Butler), corrupt accountant Stella (Thandie Newton), and unpredictable punk rocker Johnny Quid (Toby Kebbell) seem to speak it fluently. As the bullets start to fly and the double crosses multiply, there's no telling who will walk away with the fortune after the gun smoke has cleared. Jeremy Piven, Chris "Ludacris" Bridges, and Quantum of Solace Bond girl Gemma Arterton co-star(n)

programme.title: Barb Wire
programme.desc: This quasi-feminist fantasy adventure is based on a popular Dark Horse comic and is set in a civil-war-torn United States. The year is 2017 and a Nazi-like Congressional Directorate has comandeered the government. The evil CD threatens to wipe out entire cities with Red Ribbon, a manufactured virus derived from HIV. They have already successfully tested it on the city of Topeka, and only Steel Harbor remains free. Therein lives Barb Wire (Pamela Lee), a wild-haired black leather and thigh-high boot-wearing, hog-riding spit-fire bounty-hunter who carries antibodies for Red Ribbon in her DNA. Barb frequently captures her fugitives by posing as a stripper. The only time she blows her cover is when someone dares to call her "babe." Her usual reply is punctuated by a violent act upon the offender. On her latest mission, Barb has captured a rebel fugitive, Krebs, who possesses special contact lenses that can defeat the retinal scanners the CD uses to prevent people from defecting to Canada. The evil regime wants those lenses before Krebs can pass them to Cora, D a former government physician who plans to use them to save thousands of lives.. Barb ends up with the lenses and must choose between selling them or giving them to Cora. Lee (best known for starring in the long-running syndicated show Baywatch) performed many of her own stunts(n)

programme.title: Powder
programme.desc: Sean Patrick Flanery stars as an albino boy with unusual abilites, taunted and feared by his classmates. Fortunately, not everyone is afraid of him! Also starring Jeff Goldblum(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A very loose remake of the classic multi-star comedy It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World (1963), this madcap comedy is directed by Jerry Zucker, one third of the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker comedy team and director of Ghost (1990). John Cleese stars as an eccentric casino owner who devises a contest pitting six teams against each other in a race to claim two million dollars from a locker in New Mexico. The competitors are Owen (Cuba Gooding Jr., who ends up driving a bus full of Lucille Ball imitators, a foreigner (Rowan Atkinson) who hitches a ride in an organ donor vehicle, and a recently reunited mother and daughter (Whoopi Goldberg and Lanei Chapman) who anger a "squirrel lady" (Kathy Bates) -- much to their regret. There are also two con artist brothers (Seth Green and Vince Vieluf), the upright Nick (Breckin Meyer), who gets a lift from cute but psychotic pilot Tracy (Amy Smart), and the eccentric Pear family, headed up by Jon Lovitz. Rat Race also stars Dave Thomas, Kathy Najimy, Wayne Knight, Dean Cain, and Paul Rodriguez(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: A doctor dabbles in magical resurrection with horrific consequences in this supernatural thriller adapted from the novel by Stephen King. When Dr. Louis Creed (Dale Midkiff) and his family move from Chicago to an old farmhouse in rural Maine, their only concern is the busy highway that flanks their new home. Louis' family -- wife Rachel (Denise Crosby), daughter Ellie (Blaze Berdahl), and toddler Gage (Miko Hughes) -- soon meet kindly old duffer Jud Crandall (Fred Gwynne), who introduces them all to the local attractions, including a pet cemetary built on the remains of a Native American burial ground. When Rachel and the kids head off to visit Louis' in-laws, Ellie's cat gets flattened by a truck. Jud counsels Louis to bury it in the old Indian portion of the cemetary; the next day, it returns from the dead, carrying with it the stink of the earth and a decidedly bad attitude. Shortly thereafter, Louis is tempted to use the cemetary's magical powers again when his son suffers a tragic accident. A snarling kitty, it turns out, is nothing compared to the horror of a little boy with no soul and a taste for scalpels. In addition to adapting his own novel for the screen, writer King appeared in a brief cameo as the minister presiding over Gage's funeral. Director Mary Lambert would return with Pet Sematary Two(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary II
programme.desc: A liberal dose of humour is lumped in with the horror in this sequel to the 1989 hit based on Stephen King's novel. Edward Furlong is Geoff, the new kid in a small Maine town, whose veterinarian father has relocated after the death of his wife. After a friend's dog is killed, Geoff and the boy discover and make use of a 'sematary' with the power to reanimate the dead..(n)

programme.title: Stand by Me
programme.desc: In a small woodsy Oregon town, four friends - sensitive Gordie, tough-guy Chris flamboyant - are in search of a missing teenager's body. Wanting to be heroes in each in each others' and their hometown's eyes, they set out on an unforgettable two day trek that turns into an odyssey of self-discovery. They sneak cigarettes, tell tall tales, swear, and band together when the going gets tough. When they encounter the town's knife-wielding hoods who are also after the body, the four boys discover strength they never knew they had(n)

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: (1976) Brian De Palma's classic horror film, based on Stephen King's novel, stars Sissy Spacek as the teenage Carrie, who is bullied at school and terrorised by her mother (Piper Laurie), and whose latent telekinetic powers find a terrifying outlet when she is humiliated and abused beyond endurance. With Amy Irving and William Katt. M,W,R,HD(n)

programme.title: Shutter Island
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio team up for a fourth time for this adaptation of Shutter Island, a novel by Dennis Lehane (Mystic River). The film opens in 1954 as World War II veteran and current federal marshal Teddy Daniels (Leonardo DiCaprio) and his new partner, Chuck (Mark Ruffalo), ferry to Shutter Island, a water-bound mental hospital housing the criminally insane. They have been asked to investigate the disappearance of Rachel Solando (Emily Mortimer), a patient admitted to the asylum after she murdered her three children. As Teddy quizzes Dr. Cawley (Ben Kingsley), the head of the institution, he begins to suspect that the authorities in charge might not be giving him the whole truth, and that a terrible fate may befall all the patients in the spooky Ward C -- a unit devoted to the most heinous of the hospital's inmates. Complicating matters further, Teddy has a secret of his own -- the arsonist who murdered his wife is incarcerated on Shutter Island. Driven to confront his wife's killer, and stranded on the island because of a hurricane, Teddy must unravel the secrets of the eerie place before succumbing to his own madness. Max von Sydow, Emily Mortimer, Michelle Williams, Patricia Clarkson, and Jackie Earle Haley round out the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: House of Wax
programme.desc: This nerve-jangling chiller follows six road-tripping twentysomethings who get waylaid in a backwater town and visit a tourist death trap(n)

programme.desc: Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio team up for a fourth time for this adaptation of Shutter Island, a novel by Dennis Lehane (Mystic River). The film opens in 1954 as World War II veteran and current federal marshal Teddy Daniels (Leonardo DiCaprio) and his new partner, Chuck (Mark Ruffalo), ferry to Shutter Island, a water-bound mental hospital housing the criminally insane. They have been asked to investigate the disappearance of Rachel Solando (Emily Mortimer), a patient admitted to the asylum after she murdered her three children. As Teddy quizzes Dr. Cawley (Ben Kingsley), the head of the institution, he begins to suspect that the authorities in charge might not be giving him the whole truth, and that a terrible fate may befall all the patients in the spooky Ward C -- a unit devoted to the most heinous of the hospital's inmates. Complicating matters further, Teddy has a secret of his own -- the arsonist who murdered his wife is incarcerated on Shutter Island. Driven to confront his wife's killer, and stranded on the island because of a hurricane, Teddy must unravel the secrets of the eerie place before succumbing to his own madness. Max von Sydow, Emily Mortimer, Michelle Williams, Patricia Clarkson, and Jackie Earle Haley round out the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: Stand by Me
programme.desc: In a small woodsy Oregon town, four friends - sensitive Gordie, tough-guy Chris flamboyant - are in search of a missing teenager's body. Wanting to be heroes in each in each others' and their hometown's eyes, they set out on an unforgettable two day trek that turns into an odyssey of self-discovery. They sneak cigarettes, tell tall tales, swear, and band together when the going gets tough. When they encounter the town's knife-wielding hoods who are also after the body, the four boys discover strength they never knew they had(n)

The photographs showed Alison's mother holding a baby with 'Amanda' written on the back and a date of 1951, meaning Alison has a half-sister she never knew. Elsewhere in the programme, John, a builder from Yorkshire, is haunted by not knowing his father, and after applying for his adoption files, he begins the search for his birth parents, Marlene and Kenneth.(n)

Ben Fogle heads to the Exmoor coast and the picturesque village of Porlock, where he samples the locally farmed oysters that are making a comeback. Crime drama, guest starring James Fox, with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.desc: The American expat owner of a Moroccan nightclub is reunited with his old flame during the Second World War. Drama, with Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Claude Rains and Paul Henreid.(n)

programme.title: Life on the Limit
programme.desc: Documentary examining the world of Formula One racing in the 1960s and 1970s, an era when motor sport was at its most dangerous. The film tells the stories of the drivers who became iconic celebrities risking their lives on the track, and how many went on to campaign for better safety conditions in the wake of several fatal crashes. Narrated by Michael Fassbender.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone

programme.title: Taken
programme.desc: Liam Neeson stars as former CIA operative Bryan Mills, who's desperate to track down his kidnapped daughter in Pierre Morel's Luc Besson-produced action-thriller. Mills' life hasn't panned out well; his dedication to the CIA wrecked his marriage and made him neglect his daughter Kim. Now, retired from the Agency, he wants to make things up to Kim. But to do so, he has to contend with his ex-wife's animosity and Kim's new step-father's wealth. So when he has an opportunity to advance Kim's pop star ambitions he jumps at the chance, even if that means her and a friend crossing the Atlantic to brave 'the dangers of Europe'. As things turn out, he has a point: in Paris, the two girls are kidnapped by vicious Eastern European sex traffickers. As they are being abducted, Bryan tells one of the baddies, via Kim's mobile phone: 'I will look for you, I will find you, and I will kill you'. He subsequently does his best to make good on his promise, using all the violent tricks of the trade his time at the CIA taught him(n)

programme.title: The Stepfather
programme.desc: Michael becomes suspicious of his mother's new boyfriend, who is not quite the perfect man he makes himself out to be(n)

programme.title: Taken
programme.desc: Liam Neeson stars as former CIA operative Bryan Mills, who's desperate to track down his kidnapped daughter in Pierre Morel's Luc Besson-produced action-thriller. Mills' life hasn't panned out well; his dedication to the CIA wrecked his marriage and made him neglect his daughter Kim. Now, retired from the Agency, he wants to make things up to Kim. But to do so, he has to contend with his ex-wife's animosity and Kim's new step-father's wealth. So when he has an opportunity to advance Kim's pop star ambitions he jumps at the chance, even if that means her and a friend crossing the Atlantic to brave 'the dangers of Europe'. As things turn out, he has a point: in Paris, the two girls are kidnapped by vicious Eastern European sex traffickers. As they are being abducted, Bryan tells one of the baddies, via Kim's mobile phone: 'I will look for you, I will find you, and I will kill you'. He subsequently does his best to make good on his promise, using all the violent tricks of the trade his time at the CIA taught him(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp searches for a family home around Hove on the south coast of England for Duncan, Anna and their three children, as they return from seven years living in Switzerland. Elsewhere, Phil Spencer helps couple Mick and Bernie look for a property to downsize to when they retire in the South Downs.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house hunting in Essex and Hertfordshire. Kirstie searches for a family home for couple Justin and Christie, who have spent the first five years of their relationship living 50 miles apart, and are desperate to finally live together and start a family. Phil helps Cara and Ben search for a family home near Bishop's Stortford.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer offer their expert advice to more potential homeowners. In Oxfordshire, first-time buyer Tim hopes Kirstie can put an end to his two-year search for a flat, while globetrotting couple Phil and Louise have decided to settle in Gloucestershire with their baby daughter Annabelle, enlisting Phil's help to find a suitable property.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal trainer Eve Booth hosts the first dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, expressing concern that her starter of haggis and black pudding may not be to everyone's taste. Although her main course gets a lukewarm reception, the biggest threat to the evening seems to be fellow contestant Ken Brown's taste in jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer and gypsy wedding supplier Paula Thompson hosts the second party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to bring a touch of class to the proceedings with her `black and bling' themed event. The evening's menu includes fresh lobster and hairy prawns, accompanied by a spot of belly dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old languages student Donal Anand-Shaw hosts the third dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and decides to make the event black tie. He also arranges for a string quartet to play, and serves up a locally-sourced scallop starter.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debt collector Eleri Watson hosts the fourth dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside. However, her efforts to organise an all-Welsh evening do not go according to plan when soil is found in the leek soup and lamb is served burned, dampening the guests' enthusiasm.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businessman Ken Brown hosts the final dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to entertain his guests with a `wear a wig' themed evening. After annoying his fellow contestants over the past week, he hopes to make amends with his unique entertainment, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Pauline Cox's Wharfe House in Wetherby, West Yorkshire, and a visit to a local vineyard sees a clash between guest Mike Hepker and Tash Thorne.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners visit Wortwell Hall Barn in Norfolk, run by husband-and-wife duo Clive and Jenny Aylett, but when the pair's rivals arrive, Pauline Cox and Claire Smith have difficulty locating their favourite appliance. Publicans Mike Pearce and Tash Thorne are astonished to discover they cannot lock their room's door. In the morning, some of the guest make awkward requests to change their breakfast orders, causing professional chef Clive to experience a meltdown in the kitchen that leads to a fundamental error.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Bath Lodge Castle in Somerset for the third day of the competition, where they are wowed by Karen and Mike Hepker's luxury castle experience. Although the guests are disappointed at the bathroom fixtures and fittings, they are given the chance to vent their emotions during an afternoon of painting in the castle grounds. Plus, tensions rise between Mike and Tash at dinner, and harsh comments at feedback lead the hosts to suspect game playing.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to The Old Lodge Hotel in Gosport, Hampshire, run by publicans Mike Pearce and Tash Thorne. Karen Hepker is disappointed with the honeymoon suite, while Clive and Jenny Aylett find a dubious looking splash guard in the shower. A boat tour backfires when Jenny struggles with her water phobia and at dinner Karen takes the opportunity to tell the others exactly what she thinks of them. But things really kick off when it comes to feedback time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wharfe House hosts Pauline Cox and Claire Smith begin a bitter debate, demanding to know why their beds caused such a sleepless night. Accusations subsequently fly in all directions and walk-outs look on the cards as tensions mount leading to the payments being revealed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charity manager Andrew Batsford hosts the first of a week of parties from Hastings, aiming to inspire his fellow contestants with a menu of dishes prepared using foraged ingredients, including sea broccoli and stinging nettles. However, if the food fails to win them over, he hopes a dynamic Wham!-themed evening of festivities will do the trick.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day of the competition in Hastings, East Sussex, and retired solicitor Adrian Carter is hoping to impress his guests with a Moroccan-themed evening. However, disaster strikes when he neglects his tagine, and his rendition of a Rod Stewart classic does not go down well either.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sally-Anne Keller hosts a German-themed dinner party on the third night in Hastings, East Sussex, and requires her guests to dress, sing and dance accordingly. Charity manager Andrew Batsford explains how the principles of anarchism and punk can be applied to football, while retired solicitor Adrian Carter dresses as the 19th-century statesman Otto von Bismarck and raises eyebrows with his jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Kate Eadon hosts the fourth dinner party in Hastings, East Sussex, with a menu styled on a gourmet pub meal. Adrian Carter gets himself in hot water, Sally-Anne Keller reveals a surprise celebrity crush, and the host recounts her own encounter with a famous funnyman.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The confident Stelios Michael hosts the final night in Hastings, East Sussex, hoping to impress his guests with a Greek-inspired evening. The diners get involved when they receive a masterclass in the country's traditional dance, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chester's 18 chimpanzees face upheaval when new female chimp Vila arrives from a zoo in Germany. Meanwhile, nine-year-old cheetah mum Kinky Tail is vomiting after meals, and her three-year-old daughter Safi must watch and wait as her mum is taken to the zoo's medical centre. Cameras also follow Asian short-clawed otter Annie, who recently gave birth to a large litter of five pups.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: A sense of dread descends on Craggy Island as the priests prepare for poker-faced Father Stone's annual visit - and Ted tries desperately to think of a scheme to get rid of him. Clerical comedy, starring Dermot Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Bishop Brennan orders Ted and Dougal to campaign against a controversial film - but as a result of their protest it becomes the biggest box-office hit in Craggy Island's history. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon, Frank Kelly and Pauline McLynn.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: With attitudes to feminism, foreigners and family values being somewhat different 40 years ago, the second of two programmes narrated by Matt Lucas focuses on `good old-fashioned Britishness' on TV in the 1970s. From blacking-up in popular pre-watershed programmes, through to homophobia and xenophobia, the decade seems to have had a different set of manners and morals, and took a casual approach to sexism and racism. Looking back on a selection of surprising clips are the people who made the shows, those who watched them at the time, and younger viewers providing a fresh perspective.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous words-and-numbers quiz, with regular team captain Sean Lock and guest captain Sarah Millican joined by Bob Mortimer and Katherine Ryan. Alex Horne and the Horne Section preside alongside Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Regular team captain Sean Lock is joined by Andrew Flintoff to battle guest captain Bill Bailey and team-mate Roisin Conaty as Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the comedy panel quiz show mash-up. Susie Dent is ably assisted by Rob Beckett in the Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley deals with the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Park's Edge restaurant in Atlanta, Georgia, where a series of spats with the local community are hampering its success. Owners Richard and Jorge's in-fighting has alienated locals, and the duo's suggestion that customer numbers are low because of racism has heightened tensions.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: With attitudes to feminism, foreigners and family values being somewhat different 40 years ago, the second of two programmes narrated by Matt Lucas focuses on `good old-fashioned Britishness' on TV in the 1970s. From blacking-up in popular pre-watershed programmes, through to homophobia and xenophobia, the decade seems to have had a different set of manners and morals, and took a casual approach to sexism and racism. Looking back on a selection of surprising clips are the people who made the shows, those who watched them at the time, and younger viewers providing a fresh perspective.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Guests Russell Kane, Mark Watson, Example and Louise Redknapp join the irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr. Teams captained by Sean Lock and Jon Richardson answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Jasmine Harman help a couple who are torn between returning to family roots in Northumberland or heading to the warmer climate of southern France. Phil and Liz need to find a place big enough to cater for their large family and are searching for somewhere with plenty of land.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.sub-title: Colne Estuary v Canal du Midi.
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps a couple with a love of barges and canals downsize to a property near a waterway so they can pursue their ideal lifestyle and hobbies. Lisa would like to relocate to the Colne Estuary in Essex, but her partner Michael is drawn to the Canal du Midi in southern France.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the King's Head in Addlethorpe, Lincolnshire, where landlady Helen Coy and her bar manager and best friend Emma Green are pulling out all the stops to win. The B&B owners are taken back to their childhood at the funfair, At dinner, B&B beginners Louise and Andy Macbeth rattle nerves when Louise reveals her past career as a hospitality journalist - leaving pub veteran Helen less than impressed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: B&B newcomers Andy and Louise Macbeth invite their rival hoteliers to spend the night at the dog-friendly Beck Hall in North Yorkshire, where an extra-critical Helen and Emma discover what they believe to be stray dog hairs in their bed. A fishing trip makes Terri feel a little out of sorts, and when the time arrives for feedback, the managers are surprised to learn two of their guests have indicated they would not come back for a second stay.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Albaston in Torquay for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed by owners and avid souvenir collectors, Kevin and Julie Shadbolt. Terri and Stuart are impressed by their room, but are startled by the memorabilia in the communal lounge, and expectations are raised at dinner when Kevin reveals he has a secret recipe for success when it comes to breakfast. However, at feedback the next day, tensions begin to rise.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay of the week is in Bournemouth, at Terri and Stewart's specialist dance holiday venue the Hotel Piccadilly, where a class in the grand ballroom soon has the guests in a spin. However, temperatures rise over dinner when the simmering tension between Louise and Helen finally boils over.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet up for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. King's Head landlady Helen challenges Louise and Andy about the problems they reported on cleanliness in the bathroom. while Louise and Andy from Beck Hall get hot under the collar when the others criticise their dog-friendly approach.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman help recently widowed Jan decide whether to spend her £100,000 budget on a house near to her sister in Kent, or a renovation project to keep her busy in Abruzzo, Italy.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A range of properties in Bournemouth, Dorset, and Sicily provide food for thought for Paul and Chris, the owners of a B&B in northern France who are ready for a slower pace of life in a different country.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Queenborough, Kent: Castle in the Round.
programme.desc: The team travels to Queenborough Castle on the Isle of Sheppey, Kent, the last royal castle constructed in medieval Britain. It was apparently built to defend the Thames Estuary, but historians believe it could have been planned as a bolthole for Edward III to escape the Black Death.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Blackpatch, Sussex: Sussex Ups and Downs.
programme.desc: The team visits a site in the South Downs in West Sussex that was first discovered in the 1920s. The Stone Age landscape is littered with the remains of 6,000-year-old flint mines, and the experts believe it could include a Neolithic settlement, making it one of the rarest examples in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller tends a parakeet with a broken leg and a much-loved cat that needs its thyroid gland removed, while the vet's own puppy is rushed in after swallowing a baby's dummy.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect heads off to Italy, where it seems the residents have also been bitten by the `small buildings are beautiful' bug. The most spectacular place he visits is so high up in the mountains that it's only accessible by helicopter, but this difficulty is more than made up for by the views seen from it. Back in Britain, George meets a man turning a wrecked private jet into a crash pad and a Gypsy tattoo artist with big plans for an old railway carriage. George also challenges his pal, craftsman Will Hardie, to create a woodland retreat for less than the price of a family holiday.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Pru and Richard Irvine decide to build a family home on an old industrial site in the Midlothian countryside, but will only be allowed to go ahead if their house blends in with the landscape. Unfortunately, the modern property they envisage could be considered an eyesore by the conservative locals and they underestimate the long hours needed to manage the project. Kevin McCloud monitors their progress.(n)

programme.title: All Gardens Great and Small
programme.desc: New series. Plantswoman Dee Hart Dyke travels around Britain meeting people opening their gardens to visitors through the National Garden Scheme, as well as trying to convert her daughter Miranda Hart to the joys of gardening. In the first episode, Dee meets a woman who is preparing to open her small urban garden for the very first time, while Julian Clary shows her around the Kent garden he has lovingly restored. Narrated by Miranda Hart.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Location, Location, Location's Phil Spencer takes his cocker spaniels out in Windsor Great Park, while BBC Radio 4 presenter Clive Anderson tours the Isle of Mull with his terrier. Meanwhile, Katy Brand and her own beloved pooch amble through Constable country, as she sets out to explore the landscape that inspired the renowned painter.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff and patients at St George's in south west London talk about the importance of family support when dealing with difficult circumstances. Fifty-one-year-old painter and decorator Gary is rushed to St George's after falling 10 feet from a ladder. Cameras also follow five-year-old Beatriz, who has symptoms of a fever. She has a rare kidney condition that affects her immune system, making her vulnerable to infection.(n)

programme.title: Talk Stoop
programme.desc: Interviews with celebrities and newsmakers are conducted on a Brooklyn stoop(n)

programme.title: 1st Look
programme.desc: An entertainment guide to restaurants, nightlife and travel across the country(n)

programme.title: Open House NYC

programme.title: Swamp Men
programme.desc: Swamp Shootout. The Seminole Tribe of Florida has taken over management of Billie Swamp Safari, and for incoming Director Brian Zepeda, it's an opportunity to educate the public about the tribe's long history living in the Everglades. Brian's first project will be one of the region's biggest Native American cultural events: The Seminole Shoot-out, a war re-enactment. As Operations Manager, Jay Osceola is responsible for ensuring the well-being of the park's animals and guests. It's up to him to keep the park running in spite of a drought that has left water levels dangerously low. Jay's younger brother Everett has also joined the staff to handle alligators - though he's never confronted a live gator face-to-face. Lesson #1 will be surviving his first class, which includes catching a gator in the swamp. While the young Swamp Men on Billie Swamp staff are still in training, The Seminole Tribe's Wildlife Officers arrive to keep the peace and manage the reptile population. 'Cattail' and 'One Bear' have decades of experience in the Everglades, but even they are tested when nuisance alligators turn up next to a housing development, and the toughest gator at Safari threatens to eat his own offspring(n)

programme.title: Swamp Men
programme.desc: One Bad Gator. An aggressive bull alligator is relocated from a nearby wildlife park; wild hogs are hunted at the Big Cypress Seminole Indian Reservation; Everett trains to be a swamp-buggy tour guide(n)

programme.title: Swamp Men
programme.desc: Most Wanted. Trump, the park's aging 800-lb. alligator, has an abscess removed; new employees get a hands-on lesson in handling alligators; water is brought to a drought-stricken area of the park that serves as a safe haven for nuisance gators(n)

programme.title: Swamp Men
programme.desc: Gator Beatdown. A nuisance alligator has taken over a Seminole fishing spot. Tribe wildlife officers, 'Onebear' Batista and Jonathan 'Cattail' Vazquez, are determined to remove the clever gator, even if it means going to unexpected extremes. Meanwhile, Billie Swamp Safari prepares the grounds and staff for their first ever Arbor Day celebration. Park Director Brian Zepeda puts his tour guides to the test, setting up a difficult swamp buggy driving course, finding out which driver is the best and who needs more work. Just days before the celebration begins, an employee is attacked by bees near a guest hut. Brian quickly calls in a bee wrangler hoping to remove the unwanted guests before the real guests check in. Across the park, employees Rey and Tatika notice that a rehabilitated hawk has returned looking for food. Assuming the hawk must be caring for young, Rey tracks down the nest, only to discover what looks like a baby hawk that isn't breathing. While Rey moves in for a closer look, One Bear and Cattail come to the park to release three captive-born, baby green-backed herons(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.desc: In this final episode, wildlife adventurer Steve Backshall looks back at some remarkable unseen footage from the filming of Deadly 60, including the rescue of a juvenile fur seal from hungry great white sharks in South Africa and a terrifying run in with a giant venomous centipede in Venezuela. There are also some funny outtakes and Steve reveals his all time favourite animal encounter ever.(n)

programme.title: Every Witch Way
programme.desc: Emma tries her best to restore Daniel's memory but time is running out. Jax meets his long-lost sister.(n)

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country girl Hannah comes searching for a dress to match her cowgirl boots, while Leslie knows exactly what she wants - but unfortunately, her mum holds the purse strings.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer finds himself in Marge's bad books after ruining a night out, so when a head injury keeps him off work, he decides to use the time wisely and reflect on his marriage - and as luck would have it, movie star Stradivarius Cain is on hand to offer a few pearls of marital wisdom. With the guest voice of Bryan Cranston (Breaking Bad).(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Gary accidentally lets slip Terese's cancer secret to Jasmine Udagawa and is determined to find out what is in Nick's mysterious folder. Amy comes to blows with Nick.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.title: SSE Airtricity League Live
programme.desc: Finn Harps v Cork City (Kick-off 7.15pm). Peter Collins presents coverage of the Premier Division encounter at Finn Park, where the visitors will look to maintain their excellent form this season, as they seem unstoppable in their quest for the league title, which would be their first since 2005. The Harps finished just one place above the relegation places last term, and find themselves precariously close to the drop zone in the current campaign, so will be eager to pick up points as they attempt to steer themselves to safety.(n)
