programme.desc: The Yorkshire Air Ambulance responds to accidents involving a bus, an injured teenage racing driver and an RAF pilot who ejected from his plane. Presented by Rav Wilding.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force as officers respond to all manner of emergency calls.(n)

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force. Rookie cop Ash is in the thick of it during a late night brawl in Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander explores a one-bedroom flat in London about to be auctioned, while Martin Roberts looks at a two-bedroom terrace house for sale in Abertillery in south Wales, and catches up with a project to renovate a pair of semi-detached properties in Walderslade in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses Australia
programme.desc: The team assists Paul and Gloria, whose Brisbane home was flooded in 2011. Property series featuring housing experts helping homeowners sell-up.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Dartford.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Dartford to meet Scott and Jenny, whose third son Charlie was born with cerebral palsy and developmental delay. The boy needs round-the-clock care, which his mother gave up work to provide, but now he is 13, the family are struggling to cope in their small home. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their end terrace, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Wigan.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and his crack team of builders, plasterers and electricians come to the aid of Frank and Christine Burrows in Wigan, Greater Manchester. In 2012, the Burrows' 35-year-old son Mark retrained as a scaffolder to follow in his father's footsteps, but was paralysed as the result of an unprovoked attack that left him with severe brain damage. Mark now needs constant care, but the Burrows' family home is not yet fit for purpose, so Frank and Christine have been forced to take their son to a care home 15 miles away. With the help of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn Bowen, Nick's experts set about constructing a self-contained apartment alongside the Burrows' two-bedroom bungalow, which will provide Mark with the space, independence and security he will need to return home for good after spending two years away.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi meets recently divorced Rajula Jasani, who is ready for a fresh start and looks at what is on the market in and around the Spanish coastal town of Nerja. The property buyer plans to invest £100,000 in a second home that she can use with her twin sons and friends, and possibly relocate to in the future.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Sara Damergi goes house-hunting on Spain's Costa Blanca for Viv and Steve Jenkins, who have a budget of £130,000 and want a property they can use for holidays and their eventual retirement.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: Rural police officers are forced to confiscate firearms following a serious allegation of threatening behaviour, while staff at an A&E department treat a man who accidentally shot himself in the arm with a BB gun. Plus, the Royal Navy helicopter crew is sent to airlift a bomb disposal squad to the Isle of Canna when an unexploded device is discovered. Narrated by Ralph Ineson.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps a couple with a £500,000 budget who would like a family home on the border between Suffolk and Essex, enabling their children to grow up away from the hustle and bustle of city life.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The sheriffs visit a major aeroplane manufacturer on behalf of an employee who believes his hearing was damaged as a result of the work. Plus, a farmer talks about getting ripped off after shearing 3,000 sheep, and a couple seek compensation after their belongings were damaged by a removal company.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: The Yorkshire Air Ambulance crew is called to rescue a man trapped under a tractor that has plunged off a bridge and is in danger of sinking. Paramedic Paul is concerned his patient may go into cardiac arrest - and there's a real chance he may drown if firefighters cannot free him. The chopper lands on a farm to save a farmer who's been attacked by his own herd of cattle. Plus, on a road over the North York Moors, a wild deer runs out in front of a biker and leaves him with serious injuries.(n)

programme.title: Secret Eaters
programme.desc: Anna Richardson scrutinises the diets of good friends Daryl and Kate from Essex, who are convinced they eat healthily. However, his big breakfasts and her serial snacking suggest otherwise. When the pair learn the truth about what they're really consuming, will they be able to start winning the battle of the bulge before Daryl's first child is born?.(n)

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.desc: The portable clinic arrives in the seaside town of Weymouth, Dorset, where Dawn Harper helps a man with blood blisters in an intimate area, advises on abscesses in the pubic region and warns of the dangers of dodgy tattoos. Also in the programme, Christian Jessen meets a patient whose prostate cancer treatment has left him with rectal incontinence, and a woman in need of jaw replacement surgery. Pixie McKenna advises a 31-year-old with a saggy body and checks in at a charity research centre where dogs are trained to detect serious illnesses.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Lithuanian mother-to-be Olga Kozlova goes into labour, but refuses to allow her husband Victor into the delivery room, selecting her mother Galina to accompany her instead. However, without an interpreter on hand, the pair have difficulty communicating with the midwives. Vicki Thompson also prepares to give birth, and discusses how she and her partner Ben have used tattoos to mark life-changing events since they met.(n)

programme.title: Babies: Special Delivery
programme.desc: Medical staff decide on how best to treat an expectant mother's skin condition.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Documentary examining the crimes of Ted Bundy, who is believed to have sexually assaulted and killed up to 100 women in 1970s America.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Documentary examining the case of John Wayne Gacy, dubbed the killer clown, who killed, raped and tortured more than 30 men, burying the majority in his basement.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes
programme.desc: A man whose hand has been severed is rushed to hospital and the team tries to free a couple trapped under their overturned Porsche. Rav Wilding presents.(n)

programme.title: Secret Eaters
programme.desc: Anna Richardson puts more overweight participants under 24-hour surveillance to scrutinise their eating habits. Colleagues and lifelong friends Faye and Laura have been working hard at the gym and are baffled by their inability to shed the pounds, so cameras are set up to capture their every mouthful. There's also a visit to a London food market, and neuropsychologist David Lewis examines whether lack of sleep makes people consume more calories the following day.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles comes to the aid of a couple in Yarm, Stockton-on-Tees, who finally found a home for themselves and their children after years of living with their parents. However, Shahzad and Waheeda's efforts to renovate the property have been met by a series of obstacles, as redundancy strained their finances.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes
programme.desc: The team prepares to amputate a farm worker's legs after they get trapped, a drink-driver causes a major accident, and thousands of pounds are wasted by hoax calls. Rav Wilding presents.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagins, Aaron Goodwin and Nick Groff travel to Kansas to explore the violent spirits living inside the Sallie House, inviting a former tenant to help investigate.(n)

programme.title: Most Haunted
programme.desc: Part one of two. Yvette Fielding and a team of investigators investigate an unassuming but apparently possessed semi-detached council house on the Chequerfield estate in Pontefract, West Yorkshire. The property on East Drive has remained empty for 40 years and the strange tales from its former residents have permeated the surrounding streets and passed into local lore.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a house in Derby, a former church in west London and a three-bedroom semi in Gretna, Dumfries and Galloway. They also follow the properties' sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson hunts for rural properties in Worcestershire, where a couple with a budget of £650,000 are looking for a home with character, a country kitchen and a vegetable plot.(n)

Plus, on a road over the North York Moors, a wild deer runs out in front of a biker and leaves him with serious injuries.(n)

programme.title: My Ghost Story
programme.desc: Large orbs are captured on video cameras in a creepy eight-sided house in Kentucky.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin reach out to some aggressive spirits in an old brothel in Butte, Montana, and Zak gets a mysterious scratch during the lockdown.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Philip Serrell and Tom Scott begin their road trip in St Buryan, Cornwall, before heading to Wareham in Dorset, where they discover whose haul proves most popular with buyers.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Another chance to see the 2012 contest, as presenters Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins invite 12 enthusiastic bakers to take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur, facing challenges devised by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. To begin with, they tackle an upside down cake, before following Paul's recipe for rum babas, a hybrid of cake and enriched dough that baffles some of the competitors. Finally, they are challenged to produce a show-stopping cake that reveals a hidden design when sliced into. Who will be first to leave?.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson hunts for rural properties in Worcestershire, where a couple with a budget of £650,000 are looking for a home with character, a country kitchen and a vegetable plot.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Cops
programme.desc: Officers search for a driver who abandoned his car following a crash on an unlit area of motorway that left a trail of devastation. Near Bromsgrove, constables Adam Toal and Paul Owen spot a motorist driving with no lights on and the situation quickly turns into a chase. PCs Dave Gaunt and Kevin Whitehouse stop a Bentley on the M6 that is being driven by a man with more than one identity.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Miami Mega Jail
programme.desc: Part two of two. The reporter goes deeper into the jail system, meeting an alleged triple murderer facing a possible death sentence. He also follows a group of younger convicts who have avoided prison by pleading guilty and attending a four-month military-style boot camp. Among them is a 14-year-old boy who may face a 10-year sentence for armed robbery if he cannot endure the harsh training and rehabilitation programme.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Documentary examining the case of Aileen Wuornos, a serial killer and prostitute who was sentenced to the lethal injection for the murder of six men between 1989 and 1990.(n)

programme.title: Hour of Power
programme.desc: Non-denominational religious service, led by the Rev Robert V Schuller.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: Beast with a Billion Backs - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of four. A planet-sized monster invades the universe and takes control of Fry, transforming him into the leader of a new religion that encourages mankind to abandon the Earth.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: Beast with a Billion Backs - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of four. President Nixon chooses not to listen to Professors Farnsworth and Wernstrom when they discover the anomaly destroys electrical devices and orders offensive action. Bender is inducted into the League of Robots after becoming Calculon's official stalker, while a heartbroken Fry decides to leave the universe.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: Beast with a Billion Backs - Part Three.
programme.desc: Part three of four. Monster Yivo uses a tentacle to control Fry as it dominates Earth and makes him the messenger, but when the invader announces its good intentions, Leela searches for an ulterior motive. Meanwhile, Bender becomes disillusioned with the League of Robots.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: Beast with a Billion Backs - Part Four.
programme.desc: Part four of four. Monster Yivo confesses his love for humanity and invites everyone to move into his abode to make amends after Leela discovered his initial motive was to reproduce. Bender is unimpressed when he learns robots are not allowed and decides to take action against the invader.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Part one of four. Bender becomes addicted to Dungeons & Dragons, and starts to believe he is really a character from the game - causing him to be committed to a robot asylum. Meanwhile, Leela enters a demolition derby against the wishes of Prof Farnsworth, who punishes her by fitting a collar that administers an electric shock in response to inappropriate thoughts.(n)

programme.title: Duck Quacks Don't Echo
programme.desc: Comedy panel game in which Lee Mack and his guests - actress and presenter Denise Van Outen, comedian Jason Manford and broadcaster Richard Madeley - attempt to find the answers to all manner of questions. They include whether Northerners are dirtier than Southerners, if people are more stupid when they're wearing swimsuits and whether it's possible for someone to fit their entire body inside a swimming cap.(n)

programme.title: WWE Raw Hlts
programme.desc: Wrestling action from the States with the over-the-top stars, featuring the likes of Roman Reigns and Seth Rollins. Presented by Michael Cole, Corey Graves and David Otunga.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Angus and Jack come face to face with the notorious Colton family of bounty hunters when they are put on the trail of a dangerous fugitive.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: An overseas mission goes wrong when Angus and the team are blamed for a terrorist bombing and they must avoid the authorities for long enough to clear their names.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: In a crossover episode, Mac teams up with Chin Ho Kelly and Kono Kalakaua from the Hawaii 5-0 task force when an earthquake traps government scientists in a building.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Angus helps an old friend from MIT university when she is forced to fake her own death in order stop someone from killing her to suppress her scientific research.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The team intercepts a terror group's message meant for Murdoc, so Mac poses as him to save the intended victim and find out why he was targeted for assassination.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire celebrate Valentine's Day with a meal at restaurant Ibiza, which is spoiled by their elderly fellow diners. However, the couple engage in role-play to spice up the evening, with Phil transformed into successful businessman Clive Bixby. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria inject some competition into their special day, and Cameron grows weary of Mitchell's PA.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell throws Lily a party to celebrate her second birthday and invites his mother DeDe - who creates tension by bringing along Claire's former lover Robbie. Mitchell upsets Cameron by blacklisting Fizbo the clown from proceedings, and insists the entertainment should be provided by a fairy instead. Guest starring Shelley Long (Cheers) and Matt Dillon (Crash).(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire have a massive falling out, and they are lent a friendly ear by Gloria and Jay respectively as they think about what went wrong. Cameron launches his Harp Attack fundraiser, and aims to outdo last year's event until Mitchell realises he forgot to post any invitations.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay worries his eventual death will allow Gloria to remarry, and decides to buy them both a crypt, ensuring they will be together for eternity. Meanwhile, Cameron makes a scrapbook to help Lily embrace her unconventional upbringing, Claire tries to play peacemaker when Alex accidentally rips Haley's favourite jumper, and Phil treats himself to a day at the spa.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay accidentally gatecrashes Mitch and Cameron's night out with their friends Pepper, Longines and Crispin, but surprisingly enjoys his time with the group. Meanwhile, Phil and Claire are concerned when Luke befriends neighbour Mr Kleezak, and despite Cameron's misgivings, Haley babysits Lily. Guest starring Nathan Lane (The Producers).(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Eco-disaster looms in Springfield when Mr Burns launches a controversial fracking operation - and while Homer is more than happy to play accomplice to his boss, an outraged Lisa calls on the services of bigshot politician Maxine Lombard (voiced by two-time Oscar winner Jane Fonda) to shut Burns down. Against the odds, however, the opponents end up falling for one another.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe refurbishes his bar, turning it into a swanky establishment for Springfield's beautiful people. Unfortunately, he alienates all his regulars in the process - so Homer begins selling booze from his garage. With the guest voices of REM.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Comic Book Guy hasn't had much luck with the ladies in the past but all that changes when he takes advice from Marvel Comics head honcho Stan Lee, who gives him the courage to ask out a Japanese manga artist - and what lady wouldn't be wowed by a bouquet of flowers delivered in a Hulk hand?.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his exploration of the archipelago with a look at how, despite their proximity, no two of the 19 islands are the same. He also uncovers evidence that evolution on Galapagos is occurring faster than Charles Darwin could ever have imagined, and encounters Lonesome George, the last remaining giant Pinta Island tortoise, which died just a few weeks after filming in June 2012. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp on Gangs
programme.desc: The actor travels to South Africa, where he meets members of the ruthless Number gang jailed in Cape Town's Pollsmoor Maximum Security Prison. Kemp learns they subject new inmates to brutal initiation rituals, then force them to choose between joining their ranks or becoming victims. Many of the lower-ranking members refuse to open up for fear of breaking a code of silence punishable by death.(n)

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: The dog unit deals with a man who has barricaded himself in his house with his Rottweiler, while a woman thought to have overdosed disappears.(n)

programme.title: Zoo
programme.desc: The team sets out to rescue Abe and Dariela's son Isaac, while Mitch and Jamie travel to California where they cross paths with a familiar face from their past.(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: Former Manchester United and Denmark goalkeeper Peter Schmeichel, Olympic bronze medal-winning snowboarder Jenny Jones and comedian Josh Widdicombe join regulars Andrew Flintoff, Jamie Redknapp and Jack Whitehall on the sports-based comedy quiz. James Corden asks the questions.(n)

programme.desc: Real-life stories of people who have been rescued from life-threatening situations, featuring accounts by the victims and the heroes who came to their aid.(n)

programme.desc: No stone is left unturned as the team searches for the culprit behind an explosion that killed three FBI agents. The office is rife with gossip about Deeks and Kensi's relationship. programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Bryan settles into his new home after a long journey from Mexico and one of his first tasks is to learn how to peel fruit. Fellow chimp Joline raises concerns when it is revealed she is suffering from aching joints, hair loss and a lack of appetite. programme.desc: Cesar Millan tries to put two rottweiler pups into rehabilitation before they grow up to be vicious attack dogs. He also helps a vizsla with a cowardly character.(n)

programme.desc: DJ `Diddy' David Hamilton receives help from animal behaviour expert Victoria Stilwell. His unhygienic Gordon setter Max is in desperate need of discipline to counteract its all-consuming obsession with bright lights, reflections and shiny objects.(n)

programme.desc: Animal behaviour expert Victoria Stilwell visits the home of Rebecca Harris, whose Patterdale terrier has become over-possessive and refuses to let anyone else near her. programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctors struggle to examine a 42-stone man rescued from his home by firemen, fearing the MRI scanner may collapse under his weight. programme.title: House
programme.desc: A man is temporarily woken from a coma to help piece together the family history of his dying son. However, he insists on being allowed to take advantage of his return to consciousness before offering assistance, and embarks on a road trip to Atlantic City with House and Wilson in tow. Meanwhile, Detective Tritter quizzes hospital staff about their boss's drug use. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A teenager is brought in after a heart attack, and the doctor challenges his team to solve the case by lunchtime. As Cameron, Chase and Foreman run tests, House suggests the patient may be suffering from a condition brought on by the death of his parents - and takes unusual steps to identify it. Meanwhile, Tritter suspends Wilson's licence to gain his co-operation. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough employs the latest technologies to explore the violence, rivalries and deadly weaponry existing within the world of bugs. This first episode examines the survival tactics of its terrifying residents including killer ants, trap-setting spiders and beetles with the ability to shoot boiling chemicals at their enemies.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues his bug-eyed view of the world of creepy-crawlies, revealing how predators defuse the defences of their prey. Highlights include the cockroach wasp, busy preparing a tasty - and very live - treat for its young, the whirligig beetle, which employs a water-based radar system, and the jumping portia spider, which feeds on other arachnids.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A further selection of creepy-crawly close-ups, focusing on courtship in the bug world. Highlights include scorpions shaking their booty, the perfume-wearing nasonia wasp and the tropical cricket, for whom romance goes out of the window as it uses bribery to seal the deal with would-be partners. One potential partner to steer well clear of, however, is the praying mantis, the female of which is notorious for eating the male just after - or even during - mating. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while there's no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The Reagans rally together to take down the leader of the gang responsible for the death of someone close to them. As Danny attempts to draw the killer out, he turns to the man's girlfriend for help. Meanwhile, Frank is left reeling by a second loss. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: An armed robbery results in the death of a police officer and Frank vows to bring the suspect to justice. Jamie is also caught up in the conflict when he and his rookie partner are assigned to protect the suspected cop killer. Tom Selleck stars.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Movie star Russell Berke is stabbed while shadowing Danny as research for his next role as a New York detective. programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor heads to Tokyo and checks out the Park Hyatt, the hotel featured in the film Lost in Translation, and goes behind the closed doors of the Japanese capital's love hotels. In the fashionable district of Meguro, Richard takes in the Claska, which was the city's first boutique hotel and has its own canine beauty salon.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: Richard E Grant travels to Venice, said to be the city with the highest concentration of luxury hotels on the planet. He discovers how a measuring error led to the building of the city's biggest swimming pool, tries out a 15,000 euro-a-night royal suite whose bed has been slept in by everyone from the Beckhams to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, and visits a hotel that keeps its doors open even when water floods to knee height. He also finds out why breaking a window once earned Ernest Hemingway a 10 per cent discount on his room.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The president Elect undermines President Bartlet by speaking to the head of authority in China and offering him a different viewpoint. Meanwhile, Josh chooses his deputy chief of staff. Guest starring former regular Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Final-ever episode of the political drama. While preparing to leave the White House for the last time, President Bartlet is joined by his employees to look back on his period in office. Meanwhile, nervous excitement runs through the Santos camp as the team awaits the inauguration ceremony. Starring Martin Sheen, Jimmy Smits, Bradley Whitford, Allison Janney and Richard Schiff.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the team search for a missing 16-year-old girl who appears to be a model student at her private school - until it transpires she is also involved with drugs. The agents fear her disappearance may be a direct result of this, but learn she could also have been having an affair.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.sub-title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation: Fear & Loathing: Lying Down with Dogs.
programme.desc: A respected socialite is found murdered in a pile of decomposing dogs after attending a function where Dr Robbins' band provided the music, leading the team into the world of illegal canine fighting. Warrick becomes increasingly distanced from the team while struggling to prove he did not kill stripper Joanna, whose body was found in his car.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate the kidnapping of a child whose parents aren't as willing to co-operate with the detectives as they would like. But when links to a Croatian mobster are discovered, their reticence becomes more understandable. Meanwhile, Jamie and Eddie go undercover in a jewellery shop in an attempt to stop a string of robberies, and Frank tries to help an NYPD chaplain who admits to being in crisis following his arrest for drink-driving. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Jon Snow and his team go beyond the wall to capture a white walker. Meanwhile, Daenerys has to make a tough decision, and Arya confronts Sansa.(n)

programme.title: Thronecast

programme.title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. programme.desc: Dawson accidentally hits a pedestrian while responding to a call. Casey and Severide continue to investigate the arson case, while Boden attends an important function in New York.(n)

programme.desc: A revelation in the Mahoney murder rattles Annalise and the Keating 5 as the team takes on the case of a veteran facing assault charges. Legal drama, starring Viola Davis.(n)

programme.desc: Blake teams up with her detective brother Scott and her father Damon - a retired police captain - to stop a killing spree in Kansas. The case could prove to be the glue that brings the disjointed family back together, but thawing Scott's frosty attitude requires the profiler to reopen some emotional wounds.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Garcia crosses paths with her ex-boyfriend Shane in San Jose amid a hacking crisis at the Justice Department. An online group known as Star Chamber has infiltrated a government website as part of its campaign to prove the innocence of a prisoner awaiting execution for the murders of several prostitutes, and it seems computer whizz Shane is involved. With Paulo Costanzo (Royal Pains, Road Trip).(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Rossi is devastated to hear his former Marine sergeant has vanished, having lived on the streets since leaving the forces, so in a bid to find old friend, the agent travels to Los Angeles to interview other members of the homeless community. The rest of the team head to Cleveland to locate a gunman who shot down four people across the city in just 90 minutes, although JJ is struggling as the secret she has been keeping from her colleagues seems to be catching up with her.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A crisis at the BAU triggers the return of Emily Prentiss (Paget Brewster) as the crime drama marks its 200th episode. JJ has gone missing and the agents turn to the State Department - where their colleague was on secondment - for a lead, but they need to act fast. Having had suspicions about JJ and section chief Cruz for a while, the team presumed they were having an affair, but the truth is more surprising.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team hunts a crazed couple who are murdering women in Pittsburgh, while Garcia and Morgan try to keep the spark alive in their respective relationships on Valentine's Day, but Garcia grows increasingly concerned that she and Sam have different ideas about their future together.(n)

programme.title: Limitless

programme.desc: Customs officers at Bristol catch three passengers carrying 87kg of tobacco. The crew of the Searcher boards a yacht on the trail of drugs, and a sniffer dog picks up a scent at Gatwick that turns out to be cocaine. John Rand narrates.(n)

programme.title: Customs UK
programme.desc: Off Cornwall, the crew of the fast cutter Searcher decides to board a lone yacht coming from the Canaries, a frequent transit point for cocaine. Officers in Dover detect a mysterious shadow in a truck full of chipboard, and in Bristol a man is caught carrying 5,000 cigarettes back from Turkey.(n)

programme.title: Customs UK
programme.desc: In Dover, the specialist rummage team discovers a ton of cannabis hidden in a truck, and in Cornwall a ship's captain lies to officers of the cutter Searcher about the number of cigarettes he has on board. programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Experience has taught the BAU that the first 24 hours are critical in child abduction cases, so it's straight on board a plane to Mississippi, where a distraught mother has a bone to pick with the relative who was supposed to be looking after her four-year-old daughter. However, the profilers are more interested in finding out why little Gabby's father has suddenly gone off the grid.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The FBI agents are drawn into the Nevada desert when two women are found drowned, and evidence left at the scene indicates the killer has eight more targets. Meanwhile, Reid uses the trip as a chance to catch up with his mother to see how she is coping with her mental health issues. Drama, starring Joe Mantegna and Matthew Gray Gubler.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The FBI agents are drawn to Milwaukee when several bodies covered with bite marks and infected with rabies are discovered in a park. Meanwhile, Reid and Garcia work out for a company fitness test, but try to hide their preparations from Morgan. Drama, starring Joe Mantegna and Matthew Gray Gubler.(n)

programme.title: The Grass Is Greener
programme.desc: An English earl is forced to open his stately home to the public to avoid going broke. When one of the tourists, an American tycoon, takes an interest in his wife, the peer enlists the aid of an old flame to save his marriage. Romantic comedy, starring Cary Grant, Deborah Kerr, Robert Mitchum and Jean Simmons.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: The Money Pit
programme.desc: Yuppie couple Walter and Anna buy a ramshackle old house and set about renovating it, only to see their dream home gradually turn into a nightmare. Anna also has to contend with her ex-husband, who is determined to talk her into giving their relationship another try. Comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Shelley Long, Alexander Godunov and Joe Mantegna.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Town
programme.desc: A bad-tempered dentist has a near-death experience and finds himself able to see ghosts. He is irritated to find that all the spirits need him to sort out their unresolved problems from when they were alive, particularly a man who wants the grouchy dentist to stop his widow from remarrying. Comedy, starring Ricky Gervais, Greg Kinnear and Tea Leoni.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming: Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel superhero movie, which sees Tom Holland as the friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man, taking on Michael Keaton's Vulture with the help of Iron Man.(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: Teenager Marty McFly travels back to the 1950s in a time machine built by his eccentric inventor friend. The return journey proves tricky enough, but he also accidentally alters the sequence of events that led to his parents falling in love - and has to persuade his future dad to win his mother's heart, or he will never be born. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Michael J Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Lea Thompson and Crispin Glover.(n)

programme.title: Couples Retreat
programme.desc: A couple on the brink of divorce sign up for relationship therapy on a tropical island, but find they can save money if they persuade their friends to join them. Three more couples go along for the holiday, thinking they do not need any help - but the unconventional treatment soon exposes cracks in their relationships. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn, Malin Akerman, Jon Favreau and Jason Bateman.(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: When it becomes obvious that his solo album is a flop, a former boy band member does everything he can to maintain his celebrity status. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg, Jorma Taccone and Akiva Schaffer.(n)

programme.title: Superbad
programme.desc: Two teenage friends are on the brink of going to different colleges, so decide to mark the event by going to a party where they hope to lose their virginity. However, they have promised to supply the booze for the event, a task that proves much harder than expected because they are under age. Unfortunately, when a friend steps in to help, the situation gets even worse. Comedy, starring Jonah Hill, Michael Cera and Christopher Mintz-Plasse.(n)

programme.title: Grosse Pointe Blank
programme.desc: A hitman takes the chance to combine his latest assassination job with a trip back to his home town for a school reunion. The occasion starts to get complicated when an old flame turns up and rekindles their lost romance - while a rival killer harasses him to join an assassins' union. Black comedy drama, starring John Cusack, Minnie Driver, Dan Aykroyd, Joan Cusack and Alan Arkin.(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: A woman more interested in one-night stands than true love is forced to reassess her priorities after meeting the man of her dreams. However, when she hears he is getting married, she sets out on a hectic road trip across America to stop the wedding. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Christina Applegate, Selma Blair and Thomas Jane.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy 6: City Under Siege
programme.desc: The clueless cops return yet again, this time to thwart the machinations of a crime lord behind a wave of raids and robberies in the city. Unfortunately, they are unaware Mr Big is always one step ahead thanks to a police informer. Penultimate entry in the comedy series, starring Bubba Smith, David Graf, Michael Winslow, Matt McCoy and Leslie Easterbrook.(n)

programme.title: In Her Shoes
programme.desc: Two sisters have little in common - one is a financially irresponsible flirt and the other is a mature and staid lawyer. However, the pair are brought together when a dark family secret comes to light. Curtis Hanson's comedy drama, based on a novel by Jennifer Weiner, starring Cameron Diaz, Toni Collette and Shirley MacLaine.(n)

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A lonely student finds her first year at university in New York a disappointing experience, with uninspiring studies and no social life. Everything changes when her mother remarries and she acquires a new stepsister, whose bizarre schemes draw her into the kind of lifestyle she had always dreamed of - and provide fresh creative inspiration. Comedy, starring Lola Kirke and Greta Gerwig.(n)

programme.title: Get a Job
programme.desc: Two college graduates faced with the prospect of deciding what to do with their lives find themselves faced with a more immediate crisis - getting and keeping a job. Their search for employment takes them through a succession of strange experiences and even stranger workplaces. Comedy, starring Miles Teller, Anna Kendrick, Bryan Cranston and Alison Brie.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: A man suffering a midlife crisis tries to recapture his lost youth by going back to his old haunts with two equally unhappy friends and his teenage nephew. They end up being transported back to 1986 and are tempted to give themselves the lives they always wanted - despite warnings that they must not change anything. Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part III
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly is transported back to the days of the Wild West, where he strives to save his eccentric scientist friend Doc Brown from death at the hands of a villainous gunslinger. Final instalment in the sci-fi comedy trilogy, starring Michael J Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Steenburgen and Thomas F Wilson.(n)

programme.desc: Two criminal brothers discover the orphanage where they were raised faces closure unless the nuns who run it can pay their tax bill, so the pair embark on an urgent mission to revive their old blues band to raise the money needed. Comedy, starring John Belushi, Dan Aykroyd, Aretha Franklin, James Brown, Ray Charles, Cab Calloway, Carrie Fisher, John Candy and John Lee Hooker.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch
programme.desc: A manic, mischievous alien escapes from the galactic police and crash-lands his spaceship on Hawaii. A lonely little girl mistakes the stranded creature for a dog and adopts him - but alien and Earth authorities are soon combing the island in search of him. Disney animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Daveigh Chase, Chris Sanders, Tia Carrere, Ving Rhames and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: Frankenweenie
programme.desc: A lonely boy uses electricity to bring his dead dog back to life. However, the presence of the animal in the neighbourhood leads to panic over a monster, while the young scientist's classmates are soon also meddling with life and death to revive their own pets. Tim Burton's stop-motion animated fantasy, with the voices of Charlie Tahan and Winona Ryder.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: Moana
programme.desc: To save her island home from a terrible curse, a brave Polynesian teenager must set sail and journey into the great blue yonder. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.desc: A buccaneer and a blacksmith commandeer a British ship and set sail in pursuit of a pirate captain who has kidnapped a colonial governor's daughter. However, their quarry and his crew are under a curse that turns them into living skeletons - and makes them impossible to kill. Swashbuckling fantasy adventure, starring Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley, Geoffrey Rush, Jack Davenport and Jonathan Pryce.(n)

programme.desc: A businessman ventures deep into the Amazon to look for his estranged doctor wife seeking a divorce, only to discover he has a 13-year-old son who has been raised as part of a jungle tribe. The boy is sent back to New York with his father, but has a lot to learn about the modern world. Comedy, starring Tim Allen, Lolita Davidovich, Martin Short, JoBeth Williams and Sam Huntington.(n)

programme.desc: An eccentric inventor creates a lighter-than-air substance and uses it to make his car fly, attracting the attention of an unscrupulous spy ring. Disney fantasy comedy, starring Fred MacMurray, Tommy Kirk and Nancy Olson.(n)

programme.title: The Gnome-Mobile
programme.desc: An eccentric millionaire, along with his niece and nephew, finds two gnomes whose homes have been destroyed. They decide to help them find the rest of the tribe, but the family's friends think the tiny creatures are a figment of their imagination. Children's fantasy, starring Walter Brennan, Matthew Garber and Karen Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: In Search of the Castaways
programme.desc: The two children of a missing sea captain receive a message in a bottle that convinces them their father is still alive. Enlisting an eccentric French professor to help them find him, they embark on round-the-world journey and face natural disasters and mutineers during the voyage. Children's adventure based on a novel by Jules Verne, starring Maurice Chevalier, Hayley Mills and George Sanders.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Queen Of Katwe
programme.desc: The life of a poor Ugandan youngster is changed forever when she is introduced to the game of chess. Drama, starring David Oyelowo, Lupita Nyong'o and Madina Nalwanga.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Secret of the Wings
programme.desc: The fairy becomes curious about the mysterious winter forest where fairies never dare to go. She travels into the cold woods, where she meets a new friend and uncovers a threat to both their homes that they must work together to prevent. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Lucy Hale, Anjelica Huston and Timothy Dalton.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Queen Of Katwe
programme.desc: The life of a poor Ugandan youngster is changed forever when she is introduced to the game of chess. Drama, starring David Oyelowo, Lupita Nyong'o and Madina Nalwanga.(n)

programme.title: The Shaggy DA
programme.desc: A boy who once turned into a dog grows up to become a principled lawyer, who runs for district attorney. However, as he campaigns against the crooked current DA, he finds himself once again undergoing a canine transformation and must find out the cause while keeping his condition a secret. Sequel to Disney comedy The Shaggy Dog, starring Dean Jones and Suzanne Pleshette.(n)

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: A bumbling, short-sighted senior citizen unwittingly ends up in the possession of a valuable jewel during a mix-up at a museum exhibition, and is blissfully unaware that a Brazilian crime lord, a female cat burglar and the FBI are on his tail. Comedy based on the cartoon series, starring Leslie Nielsen, Kelly Lynch, Malcolm McDowell, Ernie Hudson and Jennifer Garner.(n)

programme.title: Guns of the Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Surviving gunslinger Chris is hired by Mexican revolutionaries to rescue their leader from a military prison. After assembling a crack team including a knife-fighting expert and a firearms aficionado, the group embarks on its mission - but underestimates the depths to which its enemies will sink. Second sequel to the Western, starring George Kennedy, James Whitmore, Monte Markham, Joe Don Baker and Reni Santoni.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur
programme.desc: A Roman commander is posted to Britain in the last days of the empire and given a final mission to rescue a high-ranking official and his son stranded in the north. However, the endeavour reveals his true destiny is to lead the Britons against the new Saxon invasion, and marks the start of a legend. Historical adventure, starring Clive Owen, Keira Knightley, Ray Winstone, Ioan Gruffudd and Stephen Dillane.(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Former government operative Jason Bourne is drawn out of hiding to uncover more truths about his father, while CIA director Robert Dewey orders his head of cyber-security to hunt him down. Action thriller, starring Matt Damon, Tommy Lee Jones, Alicia Vikander and Julia Stiles.(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Oppressed Mexican villagers cross the border into America looking to buy guns to defend their homes and crops from bandits. Instead they encounter an enigmatic loner who persuades them to hire a band of gunslingers to teach the villagers how to fight before the marauders return. Western, with Yul Brynner, Steve McQueen, Charles Bronson, Robert Vaughn, James Coburn and Eli Wallach.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
programme.desc: As hobbits Frodo and Sam near the end of their journey into the dark lands of Mordor to destroy the One Ring, the evil Sauron unleashes the full might of his armies on Middle-earth. Meanwhile, Aragorn must fulfil his destiny of becoming king by leading his people into a climactic battle with the forces of darkness. Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Elijah Wood, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen and Sean Astin.(n)

programme.title: Rocky
programme.desc: Philadelphia brawler Rocky Balboa gets a shot at the world heavyweight title when current champion Apollo Creed decides to give an unknown boxer a chance in celebration of America's bicentennial. Oscar-winning drama, starring Sylvester Stallone, Burgess Meredith, Talia Shire, Burt Young and Carl Weathers.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Amnesiac rogue assassin Jason Bourne's long-buried memories are reawakened by a British journalist researching the secret organisation that was responsible for transforming him into a killing machine. Meanwhile, a ruthless CIA director becomes convinced Bourne is still a security risk, and plans to dispose of him once and for all. Third instalment of the spy thriller series, directed by Paul Greengrass and starring Matt Damon, Joan Allen, Julia Stiles, David Strathairn, Paddy Considine, Scott Glenn and Albert Finney.(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Former government operative Jason Bourne is drawn out of hiding to uncover more truths about his father, while CIA director Robert Dewey orders his head of cyber-security to hunt him down. Action thriller, starring Matt Damon, Tommy Lee Jones, Alicia Vikander and Julia Stiles.(n)

programme.title: Terminator Salvation
programme.desc: In a future dominated by the deadly robots, resistance leader John Connor fights to stop the creation of an advanced new terminator and searches for the teenager destined to go back in time and become his father. Elsewhere, a mysterious stranger with no memory is about to learn the shocking truth about his origins. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Christian Bale, Sam Worthington and Anton Yelchin.(n)

programme.title: American Ultra
programme.desc: Small-town store clerk and unmotivated stoner Mike is enjoying his life with girlfriend Phoebe when his world is suddenly turned upside down. He is unaware he is actually a highly trained, lethal government sleeper agent who has been targeted for assassination, forcing him to summon his inner action-hero in order to survive. Action comedy, starring Jesse Eisenberg and Kristen Stewart.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Amnesiac rogue assassin Jason Bourne's long-buried memories are reawakened by a British journalist researching the secret organisation that was responsible for transforming him into a killing machine. Meanwhile, a ruthless CIA director becomes convinced Bourne is still a security risk, and plans to dispose of him once and for all. Third instalment of the spy thriller series, directed by Paul Greengrass and starring Matt Damon, Joan Allen, Julia Stiles, David Strathairn, Paddy Considine, Scott Glenn and Albert Finney.(n)

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge
programme.desc: A German tank commander is assigned to lead a surprise counter-attack against Allied forces as part of a last-ditch attempt to turn the tide of the Second World War and prevent the invasion of his country. An American intelligence officer realises what the enemy is planning, and tries to convince his superiors that they are facing a major offensive. Drama, starring Robert Shaw, Henry Fonda, Dana Andrews, Telly Savalas and Charles Bronson.(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: A whaling ship sets sail from New England in 1820, only to come under attack from a gigantic whale that seems to want revenge on them. In the aftermath of the attack, the surviving members of the crew face further physical and moral challenges as they try to stay alive on the open sea. Fact-based historical adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy and Ben Whishaw.(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Conflict erupts between the defenders of a kingdom and an invading horde that has travelled from a dying world. Fantasy adventure based on the best-selling computer game, starring Travis Fimmel, Paula Patton and Ben Foster.(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A crook double-crosses his partners in crime, a betrayal that leaves their friend and mentor dead. One year later, they regroup and come up with a daring plan to exact revenge on the traitor and reclaim their ill-gotten gains. Crime thriller inspired by the 1969 movie, starring Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, Edward Norton, Seth Green and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa quits the ring to marry his sweetheart and become a father. However, times prove hard and money is tight, so when Balboa is offered another shot at Apollo Creed's heavyweight title, the fighter is lured out of retirement. Drama sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Talia Shire, Carl Weathers, Burt Young and Burgess Meredith.(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: A whaling ship sets sail from New England in 1820, only to come under attack from a gigantic whale that seems to want revenge on them. In the aftermath of the attack, the surviving members of the crew face further physical and moral challenges as they try to stay alive on the open sea. Fact-based historical adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy and Ben Whishaw.(n)

Crime thriller inspired by the 1969 movie, starring Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, Edward Norton, Seth Green and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: Sam Churchill: Search for a Homeless Man
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward missing persons case draws a private investigator into a battle against the members of a child pornography ring, who are holding a teenager he has been hired to find. Thriller, starring John Schneider, Robyn Lively, Alex Rocco and Rudy Ramos.(n)

programme.title: The Sugarland Express
programme.desc: A distraught mother persuades her incarcerated husband to break out of prison and help her take their baby out of foster care. However, their plan misfires and they end up running from the law across Texas with a state trooper as a hostage. Steven Spielberg's drama, with Goldie Hawn, Ben Johnson and William Atherton.(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette.(n)

programme.title: Strangerland
programme.desc: A couple move to a remote town in the Australian Outback, but their new life takes a tragic turn when their teenage children disappear during a dust storm. As the townsfolk mount a search, tension and suspicion rise and public opinion quickly turns against the parents. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Joseph Fiennes and Hugo Weaving.(n)

programme.title: Money Monster
programme.desc: A TV host and his producer are held hostage live on air by a man who lost everything after following their advice. Crime thriller, with George Clooney and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: An unstable Vietnam veteran cop teams up with a by-the-book Los Angeles police detective to investigate the apparent suicide of the daughter of a wealthy businessman, leading them to a violent and bloody confrontation with a ruthless drug cartel under the control of a retired US general. Action thriller, starring Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Gary Busey, Mitchell Ryan and Tom Atkins.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2
programme.desc: Headstrong cop Martin Riggs and his cautious partner Roger Murtaugh stumble across a plot by a South African diplomat to launder drugs money by shipping gold coins into the US via his embassy. Protected by diplomatic immunity, the crook looks certain to evade the law - while his chief henchman has a connection to Riggs' traumatic past. Action thriller sequel, with Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Joe Pesci, Joss Ackland, Derrick O'Connor and Patsy Kensit.(n)

programme.title: The Sugarland Express
programme.desc: A distraught mother persuades her incarcerated husband to break out of prison and help her take their baby out of foster care. However, their plan misfires and they end up running from the law across Texas with a state trooper as a hostage. Steven Spielberg's drama, with Goldie Hawn, Ben Johnson and William Atherton.(n)

programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette.(n)

programme.title: The Neighbour
programme.desc: When a Mississippi man comes home to find his girlfriend missing, he soon discovers the disturbing truth about his secretive neighbour. Horror thriller, starring Josh Stewart, Bill Engvall and Alex Essoe.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: An unstable Vietnam veteran cop teams up with a by-the-book Los Angeles police detective to investigate the apparent suicide of the daughter of a wealthy businessman, leading them to a violent and bloody confrontation with a ruthless drug cartel under the control of a retired US general. Action thriller, starring Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Gary Busey, Mitchell Ryan and Tom Atkins.(n)

programme.title: Careful What You Wish For
programme.desc: A teenager gets more than he bargained for after entering into an affair with the wife of an investment banker, as a suspicious death and substantial life insurance policy embroil him in a scandal. Thriller, starring Nick Jonas, Dermot Mulroney and Isabel Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Every Secret Thing
programme.desc: When a young child goes missing, suspicion falls on two teenagers previously convicted for killing a baby. Thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks, Diane Lane and Dakota Fanning.(n)

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.(n)

programme.title: Love Me Do
programme.desc: A female investment banker lets an out-of-work actor into her life for a romantic adventure with chilling results. Drama, starring Jack Gordon, Rebecca Calder and Max Wrottesley.(n)

programme.title: Backtrack
programme.desc: A psychotherapist troubled by strange delusions and recurring nightmares discovers a terrifying secret shared by his patients. The revelation sends him fleeing back to his home town, where he tries to solve a decades-old mystery in the hope that the answer will hold the key to his own issues. Supernatural thriller, starring Adrien Brody and Sam Neill.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster.(n)

programme.title: Desierto
programme.desc: A group of immigrants hoping to make it across the US-Mexico border are targeted by a deranged, gun-wielding vigilante. Thriller, starring Gael Garcia Bernal and Jeffrey Dean Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Black Rain
programme.desc: Two New York cops arrest a hitman working for the Japanese Mafia, and are ordered to extradite him back to Osaka to stand trial. However, the prisoner gives them the slip on arrival, and as the detectives hunt him down with the aid of local law enforcement officers they become snared in a vicious gang war. Ridley Scott's thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Andy Garcia, Ken Takakura and Yasaku Matsuda.(n)

programme.title: The Prestige
programme.desc: Victorian stage illusionists Robert Angier and Alfred Borden engage in a bitter personal and professional rivalry. The pair resort to increasingly brutal measures to sabotage each other's acts, while Angier becomes obsessed with the secret behind Borden's greatest illusion. Christopher Nolan's mystery thriller, starring Hugh Jackman, Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Piper Perabo and Scarlett Johansson, with David Bowie as real-life scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster.(n)

programme.title: Desierto
programme.desc: A group of immigrants hoping to make it across the US-Mexico border are targeted by a deranged, gun-wielding vigilante. Thriller, starring Gael Garcia Bernal and Jeffrey Dean Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Fatal Attraction
programme.desc: A married lawyer has a one-night stand with a business associate while his wife and children are out of town. He hopes to keep his infidelity a secret, but she is determined to continue the relationship, and begins obsessively stalking him and his unsuspecting family. Thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Glenn Close and Anne Archer.(n)

programme.title: Closer to the Moon
programme.desc: Five high-ranking members of the Communist party in 1950s Romania rob a bank and very nearly get away with the crime. When they are finally arrested, they are sentenced to death - but before their execution, they are ordered to re-enact the heist on film, so it can be used in a propaganda movie. Fact-based comedy crime drama, starring Mark Strong and Vera Farmiga.(n)

programme.title: Sunset Boulevard
programme.desc: A faded film star from the silent-movie era is fixated with making a comeback. When she meets a struggling screenwriter on the run from debt collectors, she persuades him to write a script that will mark her spectacular return to the screen. However, he takes advantage of the deluded actress, becoming her lover in a relationship where their mutual deceit ends in tragedy. Drama, with Gloria Swanson, William Holden and Eric von Stroheim.(n)

programme.title: My Girl 2
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old tomboy Vada visits her uncle in Los Angeles to write a school project about her mother, who died during childbirth. Meanwhile, she meets Nick, the son of her uncle's girlfriend, who has to reluctantly chaperone Vada round her mother's old haunts - but before long romance blossoms for the pair. Comedy drama sequel, with Anna Chlumsky, Dan Aykroyd, Jamie Lee Curtis and Austin O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: Brokeback Mountain
programme.desc: A doomed love affair between two Wyoming cowboys develops over the course of 20 years. The relationship begins when they are hired to herd sheep on a remote mountain in the 1960s, and though they go their separate ways and try to settle down to married life, they are unable to overcome their desire for each other and continue to meet in secret. Ang Lee's drama, starring Heath Ledger, Jake Gyllenhaal, Michelle Williams and Anne Hathaway.(n)

programme.title: A Street Cat Named Bob
programme.desc: Homeless busker James Bowen has a life-changing moment when a tabby cat walks into his life. Comedy-drama based on the best selling novel, starring Luke Treadaway, Ruta Gedmintas and Anthony Head.(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: Two expeditions set out to climb to the summit of the world's highest mountain. Both parties of mountaineers get caught in one of the fiercest snowstorms ever recorded, and face a desperate struggle to survive against the elements. Fact-based adventure, starring Jason Clarke, Josh Brolin, Jake Gyllenhaal and Keira Knightley.(n)

programme.title: Runaway Bride
programme.desc: A disreputable journalist hopes to get his ailing career back on track by writing an article about a commitment-shy woman famed for ditching bridegrooms at the altar - but complications arise when the pair meet on the eve of her latest attempt at marriage. Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts and Richard Gere, with Joan Cusack, Hector Elizondo and Rita Wilson.(n)

programme.title: A Street Cat Named Bob
programme.desc: Homeless busker James Bowen has a life-changing moment when a tabby cat walks into his life. Comedy-drama based on the best selling novel, starring Luke Treadaway, Ruta Gedmintas and Anthony Head.(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: Two expeditions set out to climb to the summit of the world's highest mountain. Both parties of mountaineers get caught in one of the fiercest snowstorms ever recorded, and face a desperate struggle to survive against the elements. Fact-based adventure, starring Jason Clarke, Josh Brolin, Jake Gyllenhaal and Keira Knightley.(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: A failed rock star carves out a career as a popular wedding singer, but his hopes for a bright future are dashed when his fiancee jilts him at the altar and he tries to shut himself off from the outside world. At one of his functions, a waitress catches his eye - but unfortunately for him, she is already engaged to someone else. Romantic comedy set in the 1980s, starring Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore.(n)

programme.title: Girl, Interrupted
programme.desc: A would-be writer in the 1960s is committed to an exclusive psychiatric ward by her parents after attempting suicide, but the move seems to cause more problems than it solves. Fact-based drama, starring Winona Ryder and an Oscar-winning Angelina Jolie alongside Clea Duvall, Brittany Murphy, Whoopi Goldberg and Vanessa Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Roustabout
programme.desc: A leather-clad drifter with a talent for all things tuneful joins a travelling carnival, and catches the eye of a co-worker - but her father is less less than keen on the relationship, leading to trouble. Musical, starring Elvis Presley, Barbara Stanwyck, Joan Freeman, Leif Erickson and Sue Ann Langdon.(n)

programme.title: Flirting With Love
programme.desc: Constant distractions hamper a pair of struggling New York actors who retreat to the country to work on a script. Comedy, starring Marisa Tomei, Sam Rockwell and Ivan Martin.(n)

programme.title: Girl on the Edge
programme.desc: A troubled teenage girl struggling to deal with the aftermath of a traumatic event with an online predator is sent to an innovative treatment centre. Drama, with Taylor Spreitler, Peter Coyote and Gil Bellows.(n)

programme.title: Children of a Lesser God
programme.desc: A special education teacher takes up a position at a school for the deaf, and becomes fascinated by a former pupil working as a cleaner. A passionate relationship develops between them, but their connection is strained by his insistence she learn to communicate through speech rather than by sign language. Romantic drama based on Mark Medoff's stage play, starring William Hurt and an Oscar-winning Marlee Matlin.(n)

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock.(n)

programme.title: Take the Lead
programme.desc: A former professional dancer volunteers to pass on his skills to disruptive students in New York's public schools. At first the teenagers and their teachers are sceptical, but he eventually inspires them and persuades the kids to compete in a prestigious contest - in which his classical training and their love of hip-hop fuse to create an entirely new dance style. Fact-based drama, starring Antonio Banderas, Alfre Woodard and Rob Brown.(n)

programme.title: Hitch
programme.desc: A professional relationship guru, who specialises in offering advice to lonely single men, helps an unlucky-in-love accountant to woo the girl of his dreams. However, when he finds himself falling for a beautiful gossip columnist, his usual charm abandons him and he discovers his expertise counts for nothing. Romantic comedy, with Will Smith, Eva Mendes, Kevin James, Amber Valletta, Julie Ann Emery, Adam Arkin and Michael Rapaport.(n)

programme.title: I Saw the Light
programme.desc: Biopic of influential country singer Hank Williams, exploring his tempestuous marriage and addiction to alcohol and painkillers. With Tom Hiddleston and Elizabeth Olsen.(n)

programme.title: Bridge of Spies
programme.desc: A lawyer in 1950s New York is hired to represent a Soviet spy in a showcase trial designed to demonstrate the fairness of the US justice system. In the face of public condemnation, he argues against the death penalty, a stance that years later leads to his involvement in an exchange of prisoners in East Germany. Steven Spielberg's fact-based Cold War drama, starring Tom Hanks and an Oscar-winning Mark Rylance.(n)

programme.title: The Meddler
programme.desc: A widowed mother moves from New York City to Los Angeles to be with her daughter, but her well-meaning, meddlesome ways drive her offspring up the wall. Comedy-drama, starring Susan Sarandon, Rose Byrne and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Strange Magic
programme.desc: A fairy living in an enchanted forest tries to rescue her sister from a monstrous creature. Meanwhile, the magical kingdom is thrown into chaos by a love potion, that results in a series of unexpected romances. Animated fantasy musical, with the voices of Evan Rachel Wood, Alan Cumming and Kristin Chenoweth.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out: Special
programme.desc: The making of the Pixar animation, taking viewers inside the mind of a youngster as she copes with the emotional upheaval of moving to a new town and new school.(n)

programme.title: Candy Planet
programme.desc: When her mother is accidentally turned into a sweet, Rainie and her friends must journey to Candy Planet and uncover an incredible secret. Animated adventure.(n)

programme.title: Pan
programme.desc: A 12-year-old orphan is abducted and taken away to a magical land by a band of pirates, who need child labour to mine a magical substance created by fairies. He escapes, joining forces with a roguish adventurer, and goes in search of the truth about his mother and his own destiny. Fantasy adventure prequel to Peter Pan, starring Levi Miller, Hugh Jackman, Garrett Hedlund and Rooney Mara.(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: Animated adventure about a world where storks now deliver everything but babies, until an office mishap that is. With the voices of Andy Samberg, Kelsey Grammer and Katie Crown.(n)

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc: The living exhibits at New York's Museum of Natural History are shipped to Washington's Smithsonian Institution - along with the artefact that brought them to life in the first place. Nightwatchman Larry tries to retrieve it, only to find the contents of the world's largest museum have been reanimated, including a pharaoh determined to take over the world. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson and Steve Coogan.(n)

programme.title: Candy Planet
programme.desc: When her mother is accidentally turned into a sweet, Rainie and her friends must journey to Candy Planet and uncover an incredible secret. Animated adventure.(n)
