programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One After 'I Do'. In the first episode from the eighth series, the reception following Monica and Chandler's wedding is almost upstaged by the news that someone might be pregnant, and when Phoebe thinks it's Rachel, she quickly comes up with a plan to cover for her friend. Elsewhere at the party, Ross tries to impress a pretty single woman; Chandler has troubles on the dance floor; and Joey hopes to impress Chandler's mum's date, an important Broadway producer, with his acting ability(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Red Sweater
programme.desc: The One with the Red Sweater. Monica and Phoebe speculate about who might be the father of Rachel's baby, while she wonders whether to tell the unsuspecting dad at all, and Joey mistakenly thinks that Phoebe is pregnant. Ross and Chandler frantically try to restage generic wedding photos with other couples when Chandler loses the film from his own ceremony. And Monica can't wait to open her wedding presents(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One Where Rachel Tells... Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) is on the verge of telling Ross (David Schwimmer) that he's the father of her baby (and it's about time -- he's the only one at this point who doesn't know!) Chandler (Matthew Perry) and Monica (Courteney Cox) are on the verge of taking their honeymoon. And Joey (Matt LeBlanc) and Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) are on the verge of getting into big trouble with the law -- and all because they want to take a peek at the newlyweds' apartment. A subplot involving a "bumped" couple of airline passengers had to be refilmed due to references that would have been deemed inappropriate in the light of 9/11(n)

programme.title: Friends

On his return to his native Gotham City, he takes on a new persona to fight the city's organised crime(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: The Desperate Half Hour. The Bundys and the D'Arcys find themselves held hostage when Bud's (David Faustino) prison pen pal Starla (Tricia Cast) breaks out of jail with the help of her dimbulb boyfriend Lonnie (Charles Esten). The suspense of the situation is mitigated somewhat when Lonnie and Kelly (Christina Applegate) fall in love--two brains without a single thought. This episode was originally shown in a one-hour timeslot with the Married. . .With Children series finale "How to Marry a Moron"(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: How to Marry a Moron. Conclusion. Al disapproves of Kelly's wedding plans until he learns of her love's lineage. But then he finds other faults to object to. Lonnie: Charles Esten. Pearl: Edie McClurg. Earl: Gordon Jump. Kelly: Christina Applegate. Al: Ed O'Neill(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Chicago Shoe Exchange. Al and Griff use their store's inventory to barter with other merchants to acquire a massage chair; newly licensed masseuse Kelly practices on Bud, who is subsequently injured(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Pilot. Al loses out on tickets to a basketball game because Peggy wants to entertain their neighbours in the series premiere(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Thinergy. To inject more energy into their lives, and bedroom, Peggy tries to get Al to join her on a diet(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.sub-title: But I Didn't Shoot the Deputy
programme.desc: But I Didn't Shoot the Deputy. Steve and Marcy buy a dog after their house is robbed, and Al and Peggy buy a gun, and a noise in the night tests both defenses(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with the Stain. When Ross learns that pregnant Rachel wants to move out and find a place of her own, he suggests a vacancy in his building, until he learns that the elderly occupant is not quite dead yet. Meanwhile, Phoebe is ecstatic when Eric (Sean Penn) dumps her twin sister Ursula (also Lisa Kudrow) and chooses her instead, and Monica suspects that her new maid has stolen her jeans(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with the Stripper. Rachel tells her short-tempered father that she is pregnant with Ross' baby. Monica arranges to have a 'stripper' perform at Chandlers belated bachelor party(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with Monica's Boots. Monica buys very expensive boots(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Dates Rachel
programme.desc: The One Where Joey Dates Rachel. To prepare Joey for a big date, Rachel agrees to go out with him for a rare night on the town, but each is pleasantly surprised by the other's company and they begin to see each other in a new light. Meanwhile, Chandler desperately tries to beat his high score on Monica's new Ms Pac-Man machine, so that he can erase his offensive three-letter ID before Ben visits. And Ross is finally allowed to teach an honours class, but must break the land-speed record to get there on time(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Takes a Bath
programme.desc: The One Where Chandler Takes a Bath. As Joey agonises over his secret affection for Rachel, Monica mistakenly thinks that he is infatuated with Phoebe. Meanwhile, Ross and Rachel promise not to try to find out the sex of their unborn child, but Rachel can't resist having a peek inside the doctor's confidential folder. And Monica urges a reluctant Chandler to enjoy the soothing pleasures of a scented bath, but realises that she's created a tub monster when she can't get him out(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Secret Closet
programme.desc: The One with the Secret Closet. Chandler (Matthew Perry) is determined to uncover the secrets that lie behind the door of Monica's mysterious -- and securely locked -- bathroom closet. Monica (Courteney Cox) reacts in a disturbingly sensuous manner when Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) gives her a massage. And some stomach pains lead to a quick trip to the hospital for the pregnant Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) -- and a startling self-discovery for Joey (Matt LeBlanc)(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Tells Rachel
programme.desc: The One Where Joey Tells Rachel. Guilt-ridden Joey finally confesses his love for Rachel to a flabbergasted Ross. Meanwhile, Chandler becomes nervous because Phoebe's handsome new boyfriend Don shares numerous personality traits with Monica(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Tea Leaves
programme.desc: The One with the Tea Leaves. A faulty tea-leaf reading leads Phoebe into a fling with a freak; Rachel tries to smooth things out with a jilted Joey by asking him for advice on an odd---and untrue---situation at work; Ross gets caught in a tight spot while trying to retrieve a shirt from his ex-girlfriend(n)

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: Flush of Genius. Cleveland Jr writes a profile of his father for a social studies report about his favourite American, but then feels ashamed of his dad when he falls off the toilet and suffers a concussion. Can Cleveland find an inventive way to win back his son's respect and admiration? Meanwhile, Rallo is over the moon when he realises that he's finally grown tall enough to ride the roller coaster at the fairground(n)

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: Mama Drama. A sad Mother's Day looms for Donna because she's estranged from her own mum, whom she hasn't seen in years, so Cleveland hires an actress to play her. But then he runs into Donna's real mother and makes one last effort to reunite them(n)

Western, starring Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea, Susan Cabot, Abbe Lane and Russell Johnson.(n)

programme.desc: Five convicted outlaws, all facing the gallows, are offered a last minute reprieve by the Confederacy - provided they undertake a dangerous mission.
